description:
Great English style pub, home cooked food with the usual suspects, Fish and Chips, steak and Ale pie (which I had and was delicious), cottage Pie etc.

Several pints of Boddington's were consumed, and to 'tap' the evening off my friends and I joined in on the trivia night that os held every Sunday evening.  

All in all a great time In a cozy pub with friends.
author: Justin R.

description:
Excellent British pub with a pub trivia night on Sundays. As far as bar food is concerned you just really won't go wrong and there's a decent beer and wine collection with appropriate harder options.

But really you go to a public house (pub) to meet, greet, and drink with friends a d for that this place is perfect and the option s are well and open in spades. A neighborhood bar that's worth the visit weather you're in the neighborhood it if you've been invited by someone in the 'hood.
author: Abhi K.

description:
Dropped by here for a drink and I like the casual pub atmosphere!

Chill and cozy pub place when the fog comes in, it's quite nice to stay in here and linger about it. 

Fish and chips, burgers, fried calamari and etc., are the bar homely bites here. 

Nom and cheers!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I always come here when friends and family come to town
Food is fucking great
Never been let down..use to have motorcycle meets back in the day here as well

Owner and the regular barman are super cool blokes
author: Joseph B.

description:
Came here for lunch out of our friends recommendation. Got there when it opened. Menus are on the table. Order from the bartender. First thing I noticed was how reasonable the prices are for a full lunch. Next we ordered the highly recommended fish and crispy fries and a basket of fried mushrooms. Last I noticed how much food they gave us. We could
Have fed 3 people!  Everything was hot, crispy and delicious.  Very inpressed with the fish and chips. Think they use a cod - two large pieces very generous!!  We will be back to try all the other food!  Mushrooms were plentiful and excellent too!!  Like Shepard's pie!!!
author: Donna L.

description:
Great low key bar with a decent beer selection, great food, and a very friendly staff. You can just walk up to the bar place your order directly with the bartender.

They offer 10% off your bill if you sign up for Yelp Cash Back!

The Fish n' Chips is my favorite, with two large pieces of fish and fries. Definitely worth the money!
author: Bryan M.

description:
nice sized bar to get your swerve on. 
good atmosphere. good location on geary blvd.
full bar and great food menu to order from
author: Omar N.

description:
We came here on Thursday night around 7pm - not too crowded, but not empty. There was a couple of football games on that people were interested in.

My impedes for coming here was the review on the onion rings, people seemed to love them.

We ordered the NY steak to split - it was good but a little thin so more cooked than we might have liked (we ordered medium rare - but came Medium. Served with (almost Mashed potatoes, not really "mashed" enough to call them that - some Huge chunks of tender potatoes with gravy and some sad mixed (overcooked) veggies.

The onion rings were good - but greasy. They are the batter kind - not the breadcrumb kind.

We left full just ordering that. The fish and chips looked good (and HUGE) also the Shepard's pie)
author: Amy W.

description:
Sometimes my hunger runs like Psycho Killer.
I come here for a power lunch. I'm on a time.
I need to get back.
The food here can be good. And okay.
Depends on how they cook my pork chops.
The songs they play here are a sanctuary.
And the people are locals.
They ease my pain.
My appetite complete.
Sometimes.
author: Sam T.

description:
TRIVIA NIGHT! 

If I went to USF, I would definitely hit this place up on Wednesday nights for trivia on a regular basis. Came last week for trivia, and it was very fun. The questions (ranging from categories such as Current Events to Song Artists to Picture Rounds) were not too difficult. Some questions were challenging, but I think everyone can answer at least some of the questions which makes it a good time. They also have a lot of seating all the way into the building. 

I ordered a Moscow Mule and a cider for the night; they make decent drinks to accompany your trivia. However, my friend got the fish and chips and it was extremely bland. While the fish is a huge portion, there was no seasoning, but also no fish flavor even with we added salt. Maybe skip the entrees here but grab a beer and stay for trivia/sports playing on the large screens.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
A decent British-themed neighborhood pub with lots of familiar items like fish and chips, bangers and mash, shepherd's pie, and even chicken curry - as well as more familiar and ubiquitous bar bites like burgers, chicken nuggets, onion rings, and calamari. There's a decent selection of beers, although these are generally more pan-European than specifically British.

The vibe is casual and unassuming, and the bartenders are friendly and professional. A nice place to have in the neighborhood.
author: Vincent L.

description: Lovely little pub with a great happy hour and wonderful service! Highly recommend the bangers and mash with baked beans. Great beers and ciders on tap and perfect place to catch your favorite sports team. Large room in back for parties of 6+ people. Helpful tip for first-timers: food AND drink orders are placed at the bar.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Great happy hour, great vibe. From 4pm - 6pm their drafts are $3.50. I know they have bottles and food as well a part of the happy hour but I didn't order off those to know the prices.

Food is good. Prices are great. Staff are friendly. 
Best part is: This is not a hipster bar.
author: Mandi W.

description: One more time,  a great time! CJ is running this show tonight . Big crowd, always a great place to meet locals. CJ was off work over an hour ago, but hung out like a champ to make sure the standards were held high! I love this place. Again, the food here is excellent.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Looks like a restaurant, but it is actually a bar.

Food has pretty good prices at very good sized portions.

Food taste is pretty average, you're mostly coming here for quantity.

Fish was a bit greasy, fries were a bit subpar.
author: Joey H.

description:
This is a social restaurant and bar. Always hits the spot! Good beer good company what more can a man ask for? Came here with friends several times this month. We always have a great time and to be frank drink too much.

In summary cheap hearty food and sports on the TV too. I'll be back.
author: Christian S.

description: I wanted to give this place 1 star so I could keep it hidden in my back pocket but my conscience got the better of me.
author: Hector O.

description:
Environment 8/10
Flavor 8.5/10
Uniqueness 6/10
Value 9/10

Can't believe it! Finally, quality chicken wings in San Francisco. And they're reasonably priced! Awesome local joint for brews, bar eats, and sports. Looking forward to checking out trivia nights.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Been a while. Thought I'd come in for a pint on Election Day. Go Labour! Go Jeremy! 
Settling in to watch Giants v Brewers.
author: D.J. L.

description:
I really dislike this bar. There are a ton of regulars, so maybe I'mjust not the "right" crowd. I have had many unpleasant experiences with the staff, but to be fair they are sometimes nice. I would not recommend this to a friend unless they really enjoy watching sports. 
The food is good but not healthy. I wouldn't order a cocktail here but it's OK for beer.
author: Emma B.

description: Really good chicken nuggets. Had football and baseball playing. Nice atmosphere. Having been to many pubs in the UK I can say this matches my expectations.
author: Zoe R.

description: Used to eat/drink here when I was an undergrad at Usf, and still stop by often. Good selection of drinks at decent prices, and they do a lot of specials. Food is delicious with decent size portions, quick service, and extremely reasonable prices (especially for SF).
author: Ian M.

description:
As soon as you see the painted sign gently swaying above the door at Geary Blvd. and Wood St., you know you're crossing a threshold to a special experience. The Inner Richmond's iconic Pig & Whistle sign invites you to leave San Francisco for a while and spend some cozy hours in a traditional English pub. 

My spouse, O, chose this old favorite as the location for his retirement send-off. We arrived early, around 4:30 p.m., with the hope the fifteen of us, could get the back room. Score!

Chris, the owner, took great care of us. Over the course of our stay, he continually carted a wide array of pub grub to our makeshift buffet table. I believe every small plate offering was ordered and everything I tried was tasty. 

As the spirits flowed, our crowd became merrier by the pint. We learned we all pretty much suck at darts, and even though we had some real tossers in our group, darts were not their forte. But we could be heard in the Outer Richmond when by sheer luck the occasionally tossed dart hit its mark.

Next time you're in the Inner Richmond, stop by The Pig & Whistle and say cheers to Chris. What a great guy. O and I remember many years ago when Chris worked at the bar and now he's the owner, married, and proud father of three.

Thank you, Chris, for a perfect evening!
author: Julian J.

description: The food is always delicious, the bartenders are always exceedingly friendly and the atmosphere is very laid back. We stumbled upon this hidden gem shortly after moving to San Francisco and it has become a go-to dinner/drinks spot.
author: Hallie M.

description: It was not too busy when I came. The food was served in a timly manner. The food here is above agerage and the people here are nice. I actually love talking to the people here.
author: Simpkins F.

description:
All right, I admit it: I'm a sucker for pubs. Yesterday we were in the mood for pub food and decided to stop in for lunch - yummy fish and chips and a tasty pint to wash it down. Portions were huge, and I love that the Pig and Whistle has food service at lunchtime. Our meals were spot on (yum! fried food!), and the bartender provided excellent and very efficient service.

Even though our lunch was great, the main reason for the five-star review is for Chris, the bartender. Turned out I'd left my phone there, got busy, and didn't notice it was missing until much later. When I called my phone (hoping it was in the house somewhere and I would hear it ringing), Chris answered right away and confirmed that he did indeed have it. I went to pick it up this morning and tried to offer him a reward for his kindness and honesty, but he wouldn't hear of it. I hope the owner reads this and appreciates what a wonderful employee he has.

Thank you, Chris, for saving the day!
author: E. G.

description:
The Trifecta:
Service: 5 
Food: 4 
Drinks: 4 

SERVICE
Great corner bar. Sat at the bar and received service immediately. No wait service. Different (for my experience) but it works. Bartender even texted his wife to find me a good dinner spot close to my hotel. And to top it off, he hooked me up with a Sambuca shot. Two thumbs up.

FOOD
Sausage rolls: 2.5 
Jalapeño poppers: 4  
Fish & chips: 5 

DRINKS
Tap beers and barcardis. Can't really mess this up but still a high-five. 

For a $ establishment, you more than get what you pay for.
author: Julie H.

description:
This is a nice pub.  The staff is friendly and the service is very good. The quality of the food is good.  Based on my previous visits.  I really like their Apple Cider and Shandy.  I also enjoyed their Cornish Pasty.  It was big, flaky, and stuffed with mashed potatoes and meat.  It also came with a side salad.  Their Sausage Rolls and Calamari Rings were Okay.  Their Onions Rings were good. It was big and appeared to be beer battered. I also tried their Bangers and Mash, it was good. It was tasty and filling.  The ambiance of the place was very good, not too crowded or loud.  I would definitely come to this place again.

Also, when you order food and drinks you need to order at the bar and pay first.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
My friends and I have been going to P&W for a while, and we have really enjoyed their Wednesday trivia. However, after a blatantly racist and hostile encounter with the staff there, we will not be back.

Last night, I met my three friends before trivia. One at a time, we went to the bar to grab drinks and order food. Me and my two white friends were not ID'd, which is very usual. I have not been ID'd since my first time at the place.

Then my (black) friend went to the bar to grab a drink with the free drink tickets we had from a previous trivia night. She was ID'd, and realized at the bar that she had left her wallet at work. She was turned down and came to the back room to hang out with us.

I grabbed a beer at the bar and handed it to her in the back room. I'll admit I should not have done this, but our entire group was years beyond 21 and I really did not think that it would be an issue that my friend forgot her wallet. She had come with us before, and it's not as if anybody had bothered to check for my ID. I could have just as easily not had one.

About twenty minutes later, the server walked up to our table and took away my friend's drink and told us that there was a huge fine and the bar could be shut down for serving people without ID. We apologized and thought things would end there.

Less than a minute passed, and the owner showed up at our table and yelled at my friend to leave. Without arguing, she started to put on her coat and gather her belongings. While she was doing so, the owner continued to yell at her about how he could lose his license, etc. She apologized, and he screamed "You're not sorry you did it, you're sorry you got caught." He did not yell at anyone else at the table, although it was obvious that one of us had to have bought the beer for her. My friend continued to apologize, and tried to explain that she was 26 and had left her wallet at work. He continued to stand over her and scream even after it was clear she was going to leave and then escorted her to the door. Keep in mind, my friend was nothing but compliant, and at 5'3" and 110 pounds soaking wet, she is hardly a threat to any authority figure. She could have walked herself out.

I walked out after her, and we spoke briefly before I went back in to close out my tab and leave with my friends. The owner continued to watch us through the window as we talked on the sidewalk about what a terrible and racialized interaction we just had.

I have never felt so much hostility, even when I was an underage and over-served co-ed nightmare. We were a group of sober adults that all the staff knew, and there was no reason for our small indiscretion to be met with such an aggressive response. From the beginning of the night, my friend was targeted for being black, starting with "checking her papers" and ending with being escorted out like a criminal. I'm sad that we'll need to find a new Wednesday ritual, but there's no way I can continue to support Pig and Whistle after last night. :(
author: Evelyn R.

description:
Not too bad for a burger 'n' fries lunch. 

By chance, was in the neighborhood for a few hours and needed a place to eat and have a quick conference call. Rather than sit in a noisy coffee shop or risk talking and driving, figured this quaint pub would be a proper Plan B.

I wouldn't encourage turning Pig and Whistle into your next coworking space, but it got the job done quite literally for a few hours. 

First off, burger and fries are superb. Exactly what one would expect from a bar. Love the thick cut potatoes. Patty was a perfect med rare. Add a pint if you're feeling frisky. Sprite for me since I was driving.

Since it was still early there weren't too many patrons to mind that I was on a laptop with earbuds. I found a quiet corner in the back and chatted it up as non-obtrusively as possible. 

Really nice bartender. Appreciate him leaving me be. Paid and left without any fuss.

I want to come back for a burger, beer and trivia.
author: Abby S.

description:
Great bangers and mash! The sausages were perfect and the mashed potatoes and gravy were wonderful. 
Good atmosphere, good prices and service was very quick.
author: Carly R.

description:
Great food, good service. It's a nice place to get some good food, plus some cheap hearty eats! The bartender was nice and attentive, told us to sit wherever and told us to order our food at the bar. 

I would say 4.5 stars, but will round up! I definitely loved this place, but it wouldn't be my favorite, but I would definitely recommend it since it was an overall good experience.

It was a nice quiet and chill location. The food was not fancy, but very good hearty British food. We got:

-Sausage Rolls - These were pretty good, I could've gotten full off just these, but we shared. :) They tasted like flaky rolls stuffed with homemade sausage meat. 4/5
- Shepherd's Pie - Very yummy. Got it with the veggies, also delicious. Didn't use any of the gravy. I liked how the mashed potatoes were also baked to the point of dry/crispy on top. Good ol' shepherd's pie! 4.5/5
-Mushroom and Steak Pie - The steaks and sauce were good. Way too much mashed potato ratio. Veggies were delicious. For me, I personally didn't like this as much, but my friends liked it. (It's okay, since I didn't order it). The flaky pastry on top ended up turning into a soggy mess really quick. It was hard to cut into. Flavor wise, it was good. 3/5
-Fish and Chips - The fish and chips were delicious!! The crust/fry on the fish was so flaky! Definitely above average fish and chips! 5/5
author: Josie W.

description: Awesome food! Love the Chicken Curry! Had it with a Black Velvet and it rocks!! Great neighborhood gathering place. Very cool bar.
author: Janna Z.

description: Well, if I haven't tried very good British food, maybe I would give this place 4 stars. (I ordered beef and mushroom pie and also tried fish and chips) Overall, it's not an awful place and it is pretty cheap as well.
author: Marina O.

description: This is a great place to go if you want to get violently ill shortly after having their fish and chips!  If spending a quality hour in the bathroom is your thing, then go for it!  The meal looked good; didn't take too long to get, but the fish was definitely not right!  Plus, the bartender was alone and after waiting about 10 minutes to have our order taken, and then going up and asking him to take our order he finally came over.  He clearly saw my friend was handicapped and when she lifted her hand for help he just waved his fingers at her.  Plus, it was incredibly noisy in the early afternoon on a Friday.  I know pubs are noisy but this was pretty intense.  That is great if you want to yell at the person who brought you to have what she thought would be a good lunch.  Good it definitely was NOT!
author: Norah M.

description: Gross. The place smelled of urine, the beer selection was paltry, and the food was what they serve in an elementary school cafeteria. The worst part was my first beer was like warm and tasted like piss. The two redeeming things from this place is: the trivia was pretty good and the beers were cheap.
author: Ken K.

description:
Such poor execution. You need to be drunk FIRST for the food to be good.

The fries with curry. Fries overlooked. Sauces from a can. Really. 

The Shepards Pie arrived with a side of veggies that looked tortured. Salad was old and undressed.
  Horrible
author: Dina L.

description:
Why does Sunday brunch have to be a waiting nightmare?

* I'm looking at you Corner Store, uh, right around the corner from this pub! *

It doesn't have to be! Starving (but not stoned) is not a good feeling to have. For casual, no wait, brunch food with big portions, Pig & Whistle is the answer. Don't look for traditional pancakes and french toast during weekend brunch. Instead you get hearty grub like meat pies, bangers n mash, burger and fries or what we all ordered: THE Breakfast: scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast and sausage and beans for less than $10. 

Wednesday night is trivia night with $3.50 beers. With a traditional pub atmosphere that's cozy and welcoming, no doubt I'll be back.
author: Janice C.

description:
The Pig & Whistle is a ridiculously awesome pub that serves British food. The staff is uber-friendly, the beer selection is great, and the food is superb. Among the things my party tried, we actually enjoyed everything, but we really digged the Fried Calamari and Fish and Chips.

And a nice plus is that even though it's in the city, you shouldn't have a hard time finding parking in the area!
author: Mark C.

description: Epic staff. Don't believe the underage brats pulling the race card when the kids get tossed for not having an id.
author: Geoff H.

description:
Stumbled in here after a great meal a couple doors down. My friend and I wanted to watch the game and have some drinks. Bonus for us it was trivia night too. It's a great neighborhood bar that's surprisingly quite roomy for SF standards. It's always a treat to deal with bartenders that genuinely feel like they enjoy what they do. The guys here are exactly that. They never miss a beat and never miss a customer who looks their way even if they have a question about something that doesn't have to do with ordering a drink. Their prices were very reasonable as well. 

I look forward to coming back to try their English Breakfast as well.
author: Joco F.

description: 10/10 value and taste. Great corner pub "local watering hole" a must visit if you're in the area and on a budget.
author: Derrick K.

description: This place has a great service, a wonderful bartender and great fish and chips. Really cozy place with good drinks and better bar food. Great for lunch with the coworkers.
author: Sal S.

description: I wouldn't eat here. Who wants to eat at a place with an 87/100 score and serves shepherds pie that gives you the shits? Not to mention the owner is a racist piece of shit who pours drinks on customers who he dislikes. Heads up, he'll try to lie and say it didn't happen and have other people back him up on Yelp. Try a decent, genuine pub than this crappy, outdated pathetic excuse for a bar.
author: Mary Ellen C.

description: This place is amazing. I did not try the drinks, and I was on there for the food. We had sausage rolls, Cornish pasties and English breakfast. The price is very reasonable. The Cornish pasties and sausage rolls plates cost about $6 dollars each, and the breakfast plate cost about $9 dollars. I will definitely come back if I want British food again :)
author: erik b.

description: Their fish and chips are amazing! Love coming here after class with my fellow classmates. It's a great casual spot for some good grub and beer.
author: Manpreet B.

description: Had the most flavorless fish and chips today. I mean nothing, nada, zilch on flavor. What happened? Plus, no sausage rolls? Ack! -2 Stars for the decline.
author: B K.

description: Came here on a random search for a place that serves breakfast and burgers. Was not disappointed. Menu is simple and service is swift and friendly. Two thumbs up. :)
author: Hana D.

description: Grabbed lunch here after having my car tire repaired across the street. What a great find! Nice staff, cozy bar, great fish and chips.
author: Alex R.

description:
I absolutely love this bar. I've been here many times and always have a great experience. 

The bartenders are nice, good drink selection, and good food especially considering the price. The portions are also very large, so come hungry!
author: Zelda M.

description:
So, I didn't exactly stop in for the Trivia Night (though I wish I lived closer so I could), but I did have a hankering for fish and chips and a lot of greasy food after working a long festival day where food happened to be scarce. 

Bae & I are big fans of sharing with one another, so we split an order of the Fish & Chips and an order of the Buffalo wings. 

The Buffalo Wings were not by any means traditional wings. They were in some crunchy/crispy batter and sauces came on the side (bbq + buffalo). We tossed the suckers in the buffalo sauce and they stayed happily crispy as we worked our way through the order. The fish and chips were gigantic, two big pieces (fried to perfection). All that was needed was a sprinkle of sea salt and a hearty sprinkle of malt vinegar and I was in fried food heaven. 

I also happened to grab a pint of beer and my man got a Diet Coke and the entire thing came out to like $22.50, which for SF seemed like the best deal on the planet considering the quality and quantity of food.
author: Siobhan F.

description:
Your neck hurts, right below the protrusion of the back of your skull. Its been with you all day, as you gaze up at the indicator light, asking your deity of choice to allow your poles to switch over without forcing you to use your EPU. The lights of the division are so close, and there is paperwork to fill out, and one of your old classmates to shoot bullshit with, and a defect card to double check before you go home. 

Somehow you're sitting at a bar.

Do you taste the pucker of well whiskey? It hurts, and it burns, and runs roughshod upon your palate. You hurt. After hours of contorting your body into the shape of a trolley coach operator your knees hurt, and your sciatic nerve, and your eyes. You remove your workshirt, and your safety vest, and your overcoat, and for a second, you could again be a graduate student under dim light in your t-shirt of a band you once saw. You could be what you once were, until the beautiful women next to you noticed your workshirt, and the graphic design on your overcoat, and the bags under your eyes and the crows feet and realizes that you aren't that which you once were, but are instead something else. 

Your beer grows tepid.

It feels almost cinematic, listening to the din of conversation as you try to focus on one thing after looking left, right, left every eight seconds over the course of 480 minutes. So you focus on the whisky, the tap handles, the bartender you know well and the barback you know better, or the used bottle opener on the standing cooler under the christmas lights. Does that feel better? Can you quiet your gaze?

You'll survive, but never fully recover, like the men working in the house of butterflies, lead sunk deep into their bones.

They know you here, and it isn't Hemmingway's "Clean Well Lighted Place" but it is a place that you can sit for a spell...and that's enough. And you sit for a spell, as your thoughts turn into the white noise of a rushing cascade from the poison, and you see yourself clearly, and you say to yourself (in the style of David Byrne) "My God, what have I done?!"

Same as it ever was.

Actual review: nice bartenders, cheap drinks, pleasant ambiance, a good neighborhood place
\scene
author: Casey U.

description: Love this place! Nice neighborhood bar, good food! My favorite is the fish and chips, large portions of food! Good pricing! and friendly staff!
author: Alexander M.

description: Sh*t service.  On Sat Jan 14th at around 12:20am (I guess I should say it was technically Sun. Jan 15th) the bearded bartender with a baseball cap and glasses spent 10 minutes gabbing away with some darts player in Spanish before even acknowledging me and 2 other customers before me.  He didn't even say sorry for their wait or mine.  Like he's doing us the big favor for eventually serving us.  Wow, Pig and Whistle- where do you find such gems?
author: Jed S.

description: The trivia here is AWESOME !!! Wednesday nights are the night to go, the drinks are extremely cheap and I think there are some deals on food too. The wings are SO CRISPY and they have fat fries so obviously the best. Definitely recommend !!
author: Kelly R.

description:
What can l say ? WOW !

Last night l was in this pub with a friend of mine who was constantly pushing me to eat fish and chips in this pub and said "Have you ever met with any one from Ireland ? You probably haven't and today we will go and meet with some irish people in this beautiful pub". We went there and ordered fish and chips and my favorite dark Guinness beer. When we were waiting, my friend suddenly got so upset and started to cry so hard. l didn't understand what was happening to her and asked why she is crying. She said that she very upset because there is no one from Ireland in the pub and couldn't introduce me to anyone. l looked at her eyes with full of emotions and couldn't say anything but a song was playing, then we heard the lyrics ; "Don't you worry, don't you worry child,see heaven's got a plan for you..." With her red lipstick and red Chanel dress, she felt like it is a sign from universe and stopped crying...

THEN,
We got our fish and chips :o) It was really delicious and french fries were REALLY amazing. l have listened the owner's interview on a podcast before l go there and l agreed with everything he said after experiencing a very nice and pretty quality food (normally, eating in a pub/bar like eating rotten carrot from a trash can). This place is really nice. Very cosy and felt like being in a close friend's house. Staffs were very friendly and caring. They really value you as a customer.

Go there, have their fish & chips and Guinness. You will love this place...
And you don't need to wear Chanel dress or Tom Ford tuxedo like me. You can go there with shorts and slippers :o)
author: Arthur W.

description: Okay so I was born in England and lived there for about twelve years and go back to visit often and I LOVE a traditional English breakfast more than anything. This is not it. Now to be fair, I'm vegetarian, so maybe the meat is incredible I can't speak to that. But here's what I'll tell you. A traditional English breakfast usually comprises fried eggs, fried mushrooms, fried tomatoes, baked beans, toast/English muffin, and some sort of meats. The vast majority of pubs in England now carry veggie sausages for people like myself. But I don't fault them for not doing that, I fault them for not including mushrooms or tomatoes or fried eggs. They have scrambled eggs only and when I asked if they could do them fried she says no so I can only assume they're pre-separated pourable eggs. Baked beans were pretty mediocre. And that was it. They kindly offered to add veggies for us which was cool of them and is why I gave the second star but the veggies were like broccoli and carrots so it didn't go with anything and most certainly did not recreate an English breakfast experience. Also got two terrible bloody Mary's. Extremely disappointing.
author: Marie H.

description:
Come for a pint, but eat elsewhere.

It's a pub with a better than average selection of British brews on tap and average food. It seems to pull a fair number of professor-type patrons from nearby USF.

I appreciated the healthy grilled chicken with veg option, but the sauce for curry fries was weak, mild and drippy.

The bartender was friendly, not much more to say.

Meh.
author: J. M.

description:
Good neighborhood pub with friendly crowd, attentive staff, good prices and decent food.  What else do you want?

Food
- decent selection of pub food
- soups and specials are quite good
- there are some good inexpensive options that enable you to get out of there with a meal and a beer for about $11

Beer
- very good selection across the range from a light pilsner to guinness and everything in between
- sorry hipsters - no pbr or oly
- if you can't find a beer here that you like, then you are just being a pain in the ass
      - like the light american piss beer, then there are 2 or 3 pilsner options that are better
      - prefer a belgian ale - they have chimay in the bottle and another choice or two
      - wheat beer, amber ale, creamy brittish style - have those too
      - so if you say they don't have a beer you like, email me with what you like and I'll tell you what they have there that will satisfy you

Bar
- passible selection of spirits, including Hendricks Gin, a couple decent bourbons, and a doable list of scotch

Service
- usually pretty good and almost always friendly
- only on quiz night can it be pretty slow, but it's pretty packed there then

Entertainment
- a couple of TV's spread around
- usually music playing
- they have a big screen projector that they lower for key sporting events (World cup soccer, etc.)

Crowd
- usually friendly
- locals are pretty cool, some of those coming in from elsewhere are cool too (some are not)

So go on in, say hi to Steve (the owner), and have them pull you a pint.
author: Jeff H.

description: Wonderful little spot. Awesome value for the price and good service. Definitely worth checking out. I got the Cornish Pastie and it was really flavorful and filling (huge plus!) even though it was considered a "small" plate. I can't wait to explore the menu and try the other dishes. We will definitely be back.
author: Gina B.

description:
Holy moly - 
Pig & Whistle gives some hefty portions!

Came here for a late dinner with the boyfriend. 
Sooo happy to find that the kitchen doesn't close until 10pm. 
My boyfriend ordered the fish & chips & I got the sausage rolls w/ garden salad. 
Both were really good & pretty unique. 
The service was friendly.
We came on a random Thursday night, so it wasn't crowded - nice, chill place for some grub & a beer.

I'm definitely coming back to try their bangers & mash next!
author: Sylvia N.

description:
Oh wow, those chicken wings!! Amazing. 
Nice and chilled place. Nice staff, couple of tvs. Local bar. Dogs allowed. Nice and laid back.
author: Holly J.

description: Great spot!  I think I was the only one in the place not greeted by name.  Had an awesome lunch!  Hope to be back soon.
author: Gordon T.

description: Good selection of beers, but sticky tables. Tough food selection for vegetarians, so it's a good idea to eat dinner elsewhere and just come here for the drinks and the vibe.
author: Allison M.

description:
Good brews, good food, and Trivia Night.  Needless to say, I've been back a few times.

I used to live around the corner while in law school at USF and frequented this place on a few occasions.  I came back this past Sunday because the girl was craving some bangers and mash (she's Scottish who was born in the UK).  I had the wings and fried calamari.  The wings were breaded, which is not my preference.  The fried calamari was also overly breaded, but the flavors were nice.  In the past, I've had the bangers and mash, Sheppard's pie, and jalepeno poppers, all of of which were good.

The 4-star review is mostly for the service and bar, but the food deserves a solid 3-3.5.
author: Ronald T.

description:
The service was great. Both the bartenders were super friendly and helpful. They brought out the food super fast too and thanked us for coming right when they brought out the food instead of after we paid he bill. 

I ordered curry fries and a shepherds pie. The curry fries were just average. The curry lacked flavor so I ended up just dipping the fries in ketchup. The shepherds pie was amazing though. It was a mix of beef, carrots, mushrooms, and peas. I loved it! Definitely recommend it. 

My girlfriend had the burger, which was pretty delicious as well. The patty had a heavy meat flavor which I loved. 

My only complain is that there isn't much seating but it's a pub so you can't expect too many tables. Overall it was a great experience. I would definitely recommend coming here.
author: Ray W.

description:
I bought some Pastys here.  There is no resemblance of what I
bought as compared to a real Cornish Pasty,  My Mother and
Father were both born in Cornwall England and we were 
raised on Cornish Pasty.  What you sell has no resemblance 
whatsoever except for the crust.
author: William N.

description:
I have recently came to the event in my life that now I require the assistance of a service dog. 

One of the jobs that my dog performs for me requires him to sniff out any place that he is in - to alert me. 

I walked into this bar on Tuesday evening with my dog, bartender not only demanded to see his and mine papers (which is against the law) but kicked us out when my dog sniffed out the allergen that is dangerous for me (fungi) 

When I returned to speak with the owner - who not only put me into tears but absolutely ignored the fact that my dog was doing its job and blamed him for being "not controlled".
author: Anelya S.

description: Owner of the building and/or manager of the pub was extremely rude. Swearing at customers is a bad marketing idea! I will not support this business and encourage you to avoid it as well. Try the other good bars along Clement St. instead.
author: Henry F.

description: I went to Sunday night trivia at Pig and Whistle, and I could not have had a better experience. The staff was took time to chat up our team and the prizes were surprisingly generous. The trivia is a little on the easy side but still very entertaining. The bar was not too crowded and had TVs for your fantasy football needs.
author: Katie H.

description: I did not like the coffee. Tried the regular coffee and the honeycomb signature coffee and they were both weak. The honeycomb had too much cream.
author: Juan W.

description: Friendly bar, nice patrons and bartenders alike.  Good selection of brews on draft.  We had the chicken  wings.  These aren't  your standard wings.  They come dry with the sauce on the side.  Very nice crunch on them.  Accompanied by a side salad.  I would recommend these.  Different but good different.  Check them out!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
There's nothing bad I want to say about this place. Food is really good (fish and chips are perfectly crisp without being greasy) and not entirely greasy for a pub. You can even state into the back to see the cooks working. The clientele is also pretty friendly without being too rowdy for a bunch of drunkards. Seating is also easy because of how much space there is, and there's so much parking around because you're in between two districts. Pints are $5, but during happy hour, draught beers are $3.50. Can't argue with that, and the bartenders are very nice.

Food is pretty solid. Fish and chips come with 2 large pieces of fish and a fairly large serving of fries. They even give you brown sauce to go with it (I tried it, and brown sauce doesn't work with this dish despite its deliciousness, so don't do that). The fish is just perfectly fried and has no briny flavor. It's good enough on its own without any lemon or tartar sauce. Their tartar sauce is also good as it's a little more tart than other I've tried, which works perfectly for me. The curry fries are tasty, but definitely need more curry on top of those bad boys.
author: Danny C.

description: Came in for a quick bite and could not have had a better experience! They'd just opened for the day at 11:30 when we came in but there was already a group of local ladies having a meeting in the back room. They seemed well aquatinted with the bartender and the owner which gave this place the local feel you don't see often in a large city. These women were all English and seemed to have a great time gabbing and eating. Now this isn't a review for them, back to my visit. Upon ordering, a burger for me and fish and chips for my husband both of which were amazing! The bartender started asking us about our visit(we had asked about meter time). She gave us some great advice about parking, walking at night, and bus info. She was so kind and genuinely caring as she told us to watch out for certain areas around town. Great food and local vibe.
author: Denise S.

description:
This is a proper British pub. You come here, because it's a PROPER BRITISH PUB. And because they have one of the best jukes in town.

I ain't hearing all this, "the bartender ignored me" or "the food was just average" or "it needs a good clean and it smells". Yep. Again, proper British pub. Speak up, look your bartender in the eye, order a beer and don't wait for them to ask you first. As for the food, don't knock it, because for British pub food, it's way above standard, trust me on this. If you don't like the smell, then you've been too drunk in other establishments to notice that's what all bars smell like. Actually, this bar is cleaner than most because they serve food, dunno what ya'll on about. Take it or leave. Love it or hate it. Pig & Whistle is exactly as advertised.

San Francisco needs more establishments like this. Somewhere I can grab a pint or two, listen to some tunes and talk to my friends, not yell, because I can actually hear them and the music at same time. Imagine that. This place makes me feel human.

Did it hurt that the last time I went it was Nimoy night and they were playing Star Trek on the big screen? Absolutely not.

Live long and prosper Pig & Whistle.
author: Sam S.

description: Very friendly staff and great trivia! We had a wonderful time. Sunday trivia starts at 8:30/9:00.
author: Emily H.

description:
Food was ok
Service was ok
Crowd seemed like a local one and didn't get too loud or rowdy when we were there on Saturday night.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Why haven't I discovered you sooner!??!! 

Came here last night for trivia night (wednesdays!) Get there early (~6/7) to snag a good seat (especially if you're coming with a group of +4) 

Trivia starts at 8:30pm and runs to 11pm. 1st place gets $30! 

Anyways, let's talk about the food, we ordered the shepards pie, buffalo wings, bangers and mash, sausage rolls. all: NOMMMM

Shepards pie, what's not to love: beef, gravy, peas under a bed of mashed potatoes neatly designed. comes with a side of beans or veggies 
Buffalo wings: crispy and brown...fried....comes with 3 dipping sauces: BBQ, buffalo ?__? and ranch or blue cheese....one of those.... like 8 pieces 
bangers and mash: I don't know what to say about it...it was good. TRUST.
sausage rolls: like meat in a blanket? surrounded by puff pastry. Comes with 5 pieces! great to share
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I've lived on the block for nearly a year and did not visit Pig & Whistle till now. I am actually pretty bummed about that because this is a great neighborhood spot. You know, the type of place where the bartender remembers you and isn't afraid to have a friendly conversation....

Anyways, I dig the no-frills, down to earth vibe. If you want seating, try to get here before 9 b/c the place gets packed! Also, come hungry and enjoy some delicious dinner under 10$.
author: Nina M.

description: Solid pub with good selection of beers, TVs for watching sports, and plenty of sitting room. We came here on a weeknight in search of dinner, so the review is mostly about the food. It's self-seating and you have to order food at the counter. The food took a bit of time to arrive but was overall a solid meal. I had the bangers and mash which was tasty and a great value price wise. Most of the dinners are less than $10 for a pretty decent sized plate (unlike the "small plates" common at restaurants in SF nowadways). We also had some appetizers including curry chips, calamari and hot wings. I would probably not get calamari in the future but the hot wings were pretty good.
author: J L.

description: My favorite of favorite neighborhood bars. This place has a great happy hour, pretty delicious curry, and an awesome selection of beers and ciders on tap. Defintely worth a stop if you are in the area.
author: Jane F.

description: This place is amazing. Food was excellent and authentic. Took my English relatives for fish and chips and they were throughly impressed.  It was like being in an English pub.  Best English food I have had in the states.  And the best part of all.  The whole menu is under 10.00. WOW
author: Steve N.

description:
Please don't come here. 

Don't come here for trivia.

Don't come here for breakfast.

Don't come here for lunch.

Don't come here for what you think might be dinner.

Don't come here to meet up with friends before they leave town.

Don't come here when I'm here for book club. 

It's a friendly little place to meet up with people and I'd really like to keep it that way.
author: Loli L.

description:
Not too shabby for a quick drink with co-workers.  ;)  

My office is nearby and P&W seems to be the respite from office life for a few hours. :)
author: Nan P.

description: This was the worst bar experience I have ever had. The waitress refused to give her name cause we're sure she knew we'd complain. Thanks for making our friend's birthday a terrible experience. On top of that, all the drinks were terribly made. I don't understand how you could make an AMF wrong or even a decent Tokyo Tea. Don't ever recommend.
author: Shirley T.

description:
This bar is RACIST. If I could give this bar negative stars, I would. 

After a rough day of class my colleagues and I headed to pig and whistle to relax over some drinks. When my friend went to the bar, the bar tender had already poured her drink, he told my friend that their card machine was broken and they were taking only cash (and that a bank machine was 3 blocks away). He should have told her first thing that they were cash only today. So she walked away from the bar to rejoin us without a drink. Then the bar tender chased after her and began to instantly yell at her. He was cursing at us and as a group of 4 ladies he really scared us and made us feel threatened. We tried to reason with him but he shouted, "F--- IT! GET OUT!" Did I mention that the drink he was upset about only cost $3.50? He grabbed the drinks straight out of our hands, spilling beer all over us, still shouting. As a group of mixed ethnicities, we have noticed the bar tender make fun of our accents in the past. They said, "How can you come here without speaking English!?" We have a sneaking suspicion that he lashed out at us because we are women and not white. Especially because he yelled, "I don't want your people in here!" We have told all of our friends how this bar treats its customers. We will never return to this bar and I am DISGUSTED by how we were treated.
author: Mary P.

description:
Plus: Beer Selection, Spacious back room, HP Sauce
Minus: Service, Smell, Scotch selection

Ultimately, this is a review of their poor customer service. I get it - bartenders are supposed to be snappy and rude. And I like a little dose of that, makes me feel like I have to work hard for their attention and helpful service. But one of the guys here was just evidently not happy to be awake, not happy to be serving drinks and not happy to be interacting with the human race. It started with him asking me for my order, then mid-my-sentence moved on to take another's order. I was confused. But it didn't stop there. Maybe they just don't like scotch drinkers at this british pub? 

I like the feel of the place -- old school & divey. They need to get their act together.
author: Luba G.

description: Came in during the day ordered fish and chips they were pretty good size and were very good. It had a good vibe and definitely will come back. Service was awesome.
author: Bryan P.

description:
This is right up the street from my house, and I'm so glad!

Great draught list, good food, casual and laid back, awesome decor (you have to like a lot of stuff on the walls to agree with me on that). 

Order at the bar from the tables, and just sit back and relax. 

It was busy on a Friday night at 7, but not so busy we couldn't sit down right away. The staff is nice.  And it's cheap. Yay.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Great place to watch sports games. Pretty good food, sarcastic and fun waitstaff. Nice neighborhood gathering place. Too bad the Warriors lost!
author: Valerie T.

description: Nice bar, nice prices, wish we could have tried the food but we choose to go there during the giants world series game. Plan on coming back when we visit our daughter at USF.
author: Paul M.

description: I really enjoyed the food here ($10 salmon special was a steal), the beers were great, too. The only thing that was a bummer was the bar tender was a little on edge and not particularly fun to interact with, but everyone has off nights and the ambiance and grub from this spot definitely made me want to come back.
author: Ari F.

description: Sticky tables and floors. Drinks seemed watered down. Some of the best fish and chips I've had in a while. Large portions and reasonably priced.
author: J. K.

description:
+1 star: Pleeeeenty of street parking! We were so excited at finding a parking spot, and then realized that there was another spot 2 cars up...and 3 more another 2 cars up! Wooo!

+1 star: Cheap ass food and beer. We got some wings, and 7 beers and the total was only $19! (I had 2 beers and my boyfriend claimed that he had 5 but I think he only had 3...so maybe it was only wings and 5 beers. =P)

+1 star: Awesome crowd. When we were there, random groups of people would start singing songs. Fun! Made me feel like I was in Ireland even though I've never been. 

+1 star: They were showing both the replay of the Giant's perfect game and the Miami vs. Oklahoma game.

They will get their 5th star when I come back to try quiz night. ;)

Oh and they had this pretty awesome poster with the names of a bunch of local SF bars and clubs. It was a pretty good list too because all the ones we recognized were still around. So we played a game and had one of our friends close her eyes to pick the next spot. Martuni's - here we come!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
3.5 STARS

The boyfriend and I were looking for some comfort food and a place to watch the Giants game for a bit before going out. The Pig & Whistle was close by so we decided to stop in.

It was pretty busy for a Friday night, which I'm sure was mostly due to the fact that the Giants were playing, but I have a feeling that it's not the only reason. Pig & Whistle is definitely a cozy, neighborhood bar and I can see why it attracts many patrons.

They have the usual bar food and many beers on tap. We decided to order the Shepherd's Pie and a burger and fries for dinner. I didn't have the Shepherd's Pie but it looked absolutely delicious if you are into savory food. My burger was juicy and the fries were great - I love wedge cut fries! 

This is definitely a solid spot to watch a game and grab some food but I wish they had more tv's! I was stuck watching a Phillies (ew!) game the whole time because the Giants game was on the tv way in back of me. Other than that, I will definitely consider Pig & Whistle when I need a quick bite to eat and want to catch a game.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Food is well priced ( $5-$8)  and yes most of it's fried, but I love fried food...so I'm not sorry :P

They were out of the sausage rolls, so I will have to be back to try that!

Ordered the chicken nuggets and fried mushrooms. Nuggets reminded me of my childhood and the fried mushrooms were not bad! Light battered and good mushroom taste.

My friend ordered the food and he asked what I wanted to drink. I figured a Moscow Mule was a pretty basic drink, but apparently the bartender (male) asked my friend what was in it. He made it though and it tasted horrible. 

I let the bartender know and he told me " well that's what you ordered". I should have asked him to taste it himself, but it was so bad I didn't want him to have to... Yes I understand this is not a high end cocktail place...but Moscow Mules are pretty basic. 

Anyways...all in all, the experience was not amazing, but I will be back to try the food!
author: Selina W.

description: Decent watering hole in a godforsaken part of town. The trivia night is super annoying, and the guy who hosts it is really dumb.
author: Tracey W.

description: Great local bar. Chris the bartender is the best. Great food and nice pours, beer and otherwise. Been going for 16 years and never disappointed!
author: Leslie L.

description: Why use instant potato mix ? So confused as to the logic here.. Make your kitchen staff actually do some prep and make real mash potatoes .. Service is 5 stars food was 2. Great price tho
author: Kenneth G.

description: Absolutely the best Shepards Pie I have ever eaten. Happened to be there when a soccer game was on the TV, and there were about 15 Irish guys watching the game. Very entertaining while I ate. I will be back.
author: Eric J.

description: The female bartender with the short hair was the nastiest woman I have ever encountered in my 25 years of life. I would avoid this place on account of her, because she is THAT terrible. Oh and to top it all off this place gave me food poisoning. Worst dining experience ever.
author: Lorin D.

description: One of my favorite places in to slug down Guinness and not deal with a bunch of douchebags.  Dartboards, awesome staff, always have a great time here.  Low-key but there is a rowdy crew of regulars that hang....tons of fun if you live in the area.
author: Kris B.

description: I love tha bar! Customer service is the best! All bartenders are doing a great job! Drinks are cheap and very tasty! Food is pretty good too. I love the atmospfere there.If I would be an alcoholic I would defenetly come here every day  :) .the only one minus is that they don't make mojitos,but in general it's hard to find a bar in SF that does ! So I'm giving 5 stars to that place!
author: Naira S.

description:
I love Pig and the Whistle. I go back whenever I get the chance in the city. The Shepherd's pie is to die for, bartenders are really friendly, people are pretty nice and friendly as well. Seems like a solid neighborhood regular stop. 

Highly recommend if you're looking for a great pint and food. It's a full bar as well :)
author: E S.

description: This is totally one of my favorite hang outs with friends! First off the staff is so amazing! My friends and I love their back room for our game nights! The food is yummy and the drinks are delish!! I love that you can reserve the back room so that we can easily have a group of 20 people for our game night! I highly recommend this place for everyone in the area and from afar!
author: Rindi C.

description: Trivia night was fun. Fish & chips were perfect for bar food.
author: Eric A.

description: Great food, very cheap too! Love the garden burger! Staff are very friendly too! Will definitely be going back!
author: Rebecca O.

description:
Came back a few weeks after my first trip when a couple of my friends rented out the back area of the bar for their joint birthday party.  The $300 minimum bar tab to get it wasn't terrible, but at the same time, I don't think the bar lost much business due to us taking up the space either since the front of the bar never seemed to get that busy.  In any case, we ended up ordering more than the minimum anyways, so it didn't make a difference.  The workers were all pretty friendly, but the best part are the drink prices - so cheap!  We ended up getting more rounds than we would have at other bars, so can't complain about getting more bang for your buck!  

Sadly, despite how great I think the bar itself is, the food here really fell short.  Such a shame too since I had some high hopes for their Fish and Chips - while the pieces of fish were big, the batter was weak and I didn't care much for the flavor.  My friend's Bangers and Mash that I tried was mediocre - sausage was generic (like what you can get at a store) and the mash was bland.  Similarly, the mashed potatoes on my other friend's Shepherd's Pie was the same, but at least she had the meat underneath to give it some taste.  I haven't had many Shepherd's Pies in my life, but she said it reminded her of a frozen version in a way.  The Pork Loin Chop that my other friend got was probably the best of the bunch, but even then it was just average.

Since I know people mostly come here for the drinks first and food second, I only took off a star instead of averaging them like how I usually do.  Plus, they still have my Carlsberg!
author: Mike L.

description:
I accidentally discovered this place, and it is a food heaven. Being from Fiji, an ex-British colony, I missed authentic British food. Well, until I came here. I had sausage rolls and Shepherd;s pie, both were so good, transported me back to Fiji. 

The ambience is nice, it is a bar scene. The staff were so friendly and excellent service. The guy who served me was nice, knowledgeable with the menu items, and super friendly chap. The didn't The woman at the bar gave me tip on re-heating the sausage rolls, which I took home. The beer was served chilled. 

I can't wait to come back here, the only downside for me is that it is far away from Bart! 

Overall 10 out 10 from me, I love these guys!
author: Sunny E.

description:
- solid beer and cider choices
- average but reasonable priced food
- very British - staff and visitors
- fun trivia
author: Julia W.

description: I wanted to eat some British pub food and this place was open late. We got there at 9pm and asked if they still serve food. They were doing trivia night and it was pretty packed. They have a room in the back with tables and a tv which was empty when I got there but 2 seats at the bar just opened up so we oarked our behinds there. The bartender informed that their kitchen closes at 10pm. We ordered their Shepard pie and fish and chips and their wings. Fish n chips less than10 dollars in SF! Shepherds pie was like 9 dollars and their wings were like 6.50. Cheap and great value at a bar. I mean who cares if some of their foods are frozen and canned gravy when they have like 10 beers on tap at like 5.50 a pint. We ate and had a beer each and the total came to 38 something. I left happy getting my fried food fix and told myself I will return with my guy friends at some time and spend hours there drinking and eating.
author: B K.

description: Whether your a USF student, local or just passing by you have to check out this bar. Chances are if you're a local then you've hear of this place seeing as the name is synonymous with good times, cheap food and good drinks. even with the prices they still managed to pull off Happy Hours which surprised me at first when I saw it on Voo (https://tryvoo.com) but when I talked to the bar waitress (who was super friendly by the way) they do have $3.50 Wells and Beers. All in all if you go here, you won't regret it.
author: Peter B.

description: The Bartender named Lisa, found a bag of a very large sum of cash and returned it to the rightfull owner. Lisa's deliberate honesty needs to be acknowledged. To all who reads this know that she is honest and full of integrity. Hats off to her.  Thanks from Jessica and Paul
author: Sophia T.

description:
I have been going here for over 25 years. I was underage for about 15 of those years as I went with my family to enjoy fish and chips or bangers and mash for lunch. 
Ita not the high end sports bar or the gastro pub style food. 
Its simple..I local neighborhood restaurant "where
everybody knows your name (at least a few bartenders)". Come here few times a month for food or to grab a cold Guiness. ..
Decent food, good variety of draft beers, affordable price..the decor hasnt changed..since I could remember...fantastic bar with familiar faces as I will always prefer as our watering hole!
author: Satish P.

description: Great service and their bartenders always keep their heads on right even when it's crazy busy. I love their trivia nights and I especially appreciate their backroom as sometimes I just don't want to deal with crowds.
author: Dylan L.

description:
Its a decent neighborhood bar.

It's biggest problem is that it's over-rated..and that's not really its fault.

The kinda bar that always has things to do, with themed nights and even some food...which frankly is ...

well bar food, its not bad, its not terrific..its bar food and taste like it.
author: Red R.

description:
Busy place at 6pm and the Bartender was the only one serving food and drinks... So slow service.

Ordered Curry Fries with our drinks. Curry was good and the fries where made fresh. Excellent combo

The place has a distinct stale smell to it! Too bad as it could be a fun place to hang around...
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
The Pig & Whistle delighted me for two reasons - they offer chicken nuggets and trivia on Wednesdays. I know chicken nuggets aren't really fine dining material, but if you read any number of my reviews you'll see I'm a sucker for novelty and it's rare that you see chicken nuggets not on a kid's menu or at a fast food chain. Were they revolutionarily good? Nah, but I do admire the fact they were there. In fact, restaurant out there - can we make this the new mac & cheese?

Trivia is packed so you'll want to get there at least an hour early to find a seat. And the questions run the gamut from music to identifying famous photos to geography to current events and more. I like that because you really have to have a diverse group of folks to do well.
author: Tiffany N.

description: I'm biased perhaps, because I know a lot of the regulars and bartenders, but I honestly think this one of the best pubs. Very friendly atmosphere plus an excellent, extensive for a bar), and authentic English menu. The owner Steve really wants his customers to be satisfied with their service. I recommend you try it.
author: Tom H.

description:
This is a nice place for some simple and tasty meat, gravy, and potatoes. The portions are pretty large and will fill you up. The general atmosphere is really laid back. 

We ordered the shepherds pie, steak and mushroom pie, and cornish pasty and they were all flavorful and good. Even the vegetables were flavorful if not slightly overcooked.
author: LeTran B.

description:
So one of my highlights of my recent road trip up to the city.  I enjoyed the atmosphere (of course being walking distance from where I was staying helped) but I really did enjoy the place enough to have made it a regular stop if I was a local.

I once went to New Zealand and visited a local pub (back before my "Christian" wife dumped me like the scum bag piece of trash no good atheist monster that I am, that Jesus guy sure has hateful followers, but I digress, f, this is a bar review, oh, well, it's relevant now that the Christians have disowned me, I spent more time with decent people drinking in pubs)....

Anyway, the New Zealand pub had this thing called "The Quiz" it was cool as can be and so I showed up, I guess randomly, on the night they do the trivia thing here at The Pig & Whistle.

Side bar:  I opened Sound Hound and cheated like crazy on the "name that tune round".....my team mates missed a couple on purpose just to disguise the fact that we sucked, no worries, we had no chance to win.

Anyway, in New Zealand the picture round had a bunch of cows and you had to identify the type of cow, yeah, like "that's a Jersey" and so forth, here in the city they had pictures of Hollywood people and a couple politicos, so it was a bit easier.

Good fun all around.

Ok, the fish and chips weren't quite so good, I had fish and chips in Northern Ireland and so I know what they are supposed to taste like.  Oh, I had them in New Zealand too, but they sucked, everything there tastes like it was fried in sheep.

So my suggestion is that the oil probably needs to be hotter (too greasy) and for the chips, here's the deal:  read Anthony Bourdain's book on how to cook fries, it has to do with tempering them first I think, or something like that, um, cooking them before you cook them.

Anyway, those couple suggestions and people will be raving about the fish and chips and since the beer selection was good, the staff very friendly and all that, the place would be five stars and always crowded with beautiful coeds, and that, my friend, sells some beer.

Unless you're in England, where they don't like chicks in the pub, but this ain't the case.
author: Michael B.

description: Enjoyed the Banger Rolls with a salad and hubby had the Fish & Chips.  Good food.  Don't expect it to be all fancy schmancy here.  Good place to hang out, watch the game, get pub food, and enjoy a beer.  Thumbs up.
author: Emy B.

description:
I had shepherd's pie, my bf had fish and chips. We both didn't finish our meals. 
The atmosphere is good though.
author: Maria O.

description:
It's a pub.  The beer is good.

Bangers and Mash were spot on - the bangers had a good snap to the skin, and the flavors were aplenty.

Curry fries were decent.   Food service was fast considering you're at a bar.  Bar service was equally fast, but that should be standard considering . . . you're at a bar.

Not much more to say here that hasn't been said.
author: Jason J.

description: The Pig & Whistle will always be my go to spot. It's a chill local English pub. The food is on point and the bar tenders are awesome. Definitely get their jalapeño poppers! Yum! They also have a pump style IPA that is served warm that I forget the name of but is so good! They support bay area sports team and will have a projector up for big games. I have watched several Giants word series games here and had a drunken good time!
author: Natalia H.

description:
For some reason any bar (or really any establishment) with the word pig in the title scores points with me. Something about the idea of a whimsical swine cooking, eating, or drinking makes me happy. 

Anyways not an exceptional bar but the beer selections are solid and they have a dartboard in the back to waste time on.
author: Misha T.

description: For a down-home bar experience and good food is recommend this place. The bar tenders were friendly, and I enjoyed the atmosphere - very casual and comfortable. We ordered a burger and fries, and fish and chips. Both were great for the price and we will visit again!
author: Brigette A.

description: I'm specifically relating this post to the food because our bartender was awesome and the beef and vegetable pie was great. My girlfriend and I specifically went here for the fish and chips but the fish was extremely mushy and soggy so much that I couldn't tell if it was old fish or overcooked. Great service!
author: Devin W.

description:
We stopped in to have lunch based on our son's recommendation.  Really nice choice!  It's not a huge place, but there are many tables to choose from during lunch time.  Very quiet with perhaps a handful of other patrons either dining or enjoying drinks at the bar.  Bartender was friendly, the food orders were prepared efficiently, and best of all they were quite good and excellent value.  Honestly the prices are really excellent.  I do hope they keep them like this for a while!  

We really miss the pubs we used to frequent on our UK visits so this one helped to fill the void.  We all ordered the fish and chips which were two good sized pieces of cod with light batter and a good amount of chips.  No mushy peas though.  Must say the batter was not that greasy stuff one gets at other establishments.

Also we ordered the calamari rings which was a nice portion to share, very fresh and lovely.  Went well as an appetizer.

Had some half and whole pints of Carlsberg to complement our meals.

I know there are other British pubs in SF, but Pig & Whistle is great.  Only slight negative is that the unisex toilets are a bit gross, but it's probably due to patrons' use not neglect on management's part.

Will be back for sure.
author: Luisa T.

description:
I am so impressed by their great food & drink service even during the World Series.  Way to stay on top of things!

Guinness on tap and well poured!
Delicious shepherds pie!  
Great chicken nuggets!  
Fish and chips were ok - not that flavorful, but felt very heavy on the grease.
French fries were ok - could use more salt, maybe a little bit more of a crispy shell.

Overall a great pub experience!!
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Love this neighborhood joint.  Awesome beer selection, but what I come here for is the no-frills Irish/English bar food.  My faves, in order:

1. Bangers and mash
2. Fish & chips
3. Shepherd's pie

The crowd is a mix of true SF locals, old Irish dudes, and USF students.  A good place to watch sports, eat bar food and drink beer.  

Oh, and be sure to come here with your group of friends for trivia night!
author: suzanne l.

description: Good place to relax and have a drink. Very chill environment and close to campus. And their wings are delicious!
author: Neli C.

description:
We came here on a Saturday night because of the many great reviews and also because we wanted somewhere to watch the Giants game.  A plus because it's British and I'm from England.

I was pretty excited to try this place.  My husband ordered and paid for our food at the same time he ordered our drinks.  While we were waiting for our food we watched the Giants game so we weren't really paying attendion to when the food was arriving but after 20 minutes and seeing other people getting their food before us when they came in after us, my husband went over to the bar to check on our food.  
They came back and said that the ticket was lost and appologized.  They told us our food was being made right away and appologized again for the wait.  After our food came out they refunded our money so our entire dinner was FREE.   The staff kept applogizing and when my husband ordered another beer they gave it to him on the house.  The staff are very pleasant and personable.  

Anyway, onto the review of the food.  I ordered the Sheperd's Pie, my son ordered the Cornish Pastie and my husband ordered the fish n chips.  I'll start by saying the flaovrs of the food was absolutely delicious.  The Sheperd's Pie was amazing with tons of flavor and veges.  The peas were not soft or mushy and the mash on top was slightly crispy.  My son's Cornish Pastie was flavorful and the pastry was nice and flaky like it should be.  
The fried fish from my husband's fish n chips was nice and flaky inside and crispy on the outside, not burnt or greasy like a lot of places make it.  
This place knows how to cook the typical pub food from England.  
I've been to many British pubs and I think the food here is my favorite.  Even though I haven't tired any of their other items on the menu I can tell they'll be good by what I ate.  

One last note.  The place is good size as they have the main pub with some table but if you go to the back they have another room with more tables you can eat in.  Also they have a projector screen to show all their sports games on which is nice.  

I will definitely be back if I'm in the area again.
author: Rosetta C.

description:
Pig & Whistle looks like a converted house. feels homey, has pics of england and sports memorobilia on the walls. dining available in back  room also.  

simple menu of english entrees in the 9 range.

sampling: fish & chip (9)
-2 enormous pieces of fried alaskan cod : fresh, firm meat, flaky and juicy
-on bed of steak fries. extra sized fries , crispy on the outside, firm/mushy on the inside. excellent value. breading barely noticeable., crispy texture.
-big daddy ipa (4.50)
-kronenburg   ale(4.50)

on draught
-parking available on side streets
-happy hour every day 4-6, pints (3), guinness (3.50)
-looks like an older crowd here.
-congenial  patrons. sports oriented.
-if one can find parking, good place to grab a bite.
-fish & chip highly recommended.
author: Victor G.

description: The Service was good, the beer selection was great but the food was just okay.  I ordered the bangers and mash, the mash wasn't so good but the bangers were pretty spot-on.  Maybe next time I'll try the sheapards pie, it seemed to be popular dish at the time.
author: Brett D.

description:
The Pig & Whistle is reason #72 why I should taste the rainbow and move to SF.  Awesome place to hang, grab a drink, grab bite to eat, or party.  I made a visit during the day and it looked like a local only men's club but then a few ladies dropped by.  The food is delicious home cooked Irish and bar food.  We had the following:

Calamari - good, nothing to write home about
Curry fries - awesome fries! Thick cooked perfectly, and great with curry.  
Fish & chips - AMD (Aye Dios Mio) perfect. 3 fish pieces as long as my forearm.
Cornish Pastie - Shepard's pie in a puff pasty.  The best tasting thing ever.room pie- great for a cold day

All this food for $36.  

I heard there is one in LA but this is not from the same chain.  I will be back.
author: Bixby D.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up.

Definitely a neighborhood bar, a spot for the locals.  We came here on a Thursday evening and stuck out like sore thumbs compared to the regulars here.  It's a largely older white man pub, made me feel like a baby, especially when the bartender confirmed that we looked like we were 18 years old. 

But self-infantilizing aside, I like this place.  During happy hour, all beers on tap are $3.  Appetizer plates are around $4-5.  Larger meals are around $8-10.  Portions are elephantine.  Yes, you get bang for your buck!  I ordered a plate of chicken nuggets ($5 only!), and I swear about 30 nuggets appeared on a huge plate.  With ranch, ketchup, and something spicy (tabasco maybe?).  Ate the whole thing.  

My friend who ordered the fish and chips also seemed to enjoy it.  It almost looked like they took an entire fish, deboned it, fried up both sides of fish meat, and served it up.  I swear, they give you like an entire fish.  

Oh, and there's also darts, and I noticed there's free pool on Sundays from 11am-8pm.  This place also seems like a great place for you to watch the World Cup these next few weeks.  I'm sure you'll have a great time with your elephant-sized fried foods, good beer, and endless soccer.
author: Vivian C.

description: BEST fish & chips. It's my local pub, wonderful food drink and locals. Shepards Pie is also another favorite!
author: B S.

description:
P&W has been better, but it seems to be on a downslide over the past year or so. The staff seem nice. I wouldn't order mixed drinks here, though. It's not that sort of place.

The food: The menu items used to be solid pub grub. Not special, but worth ordering. Apparently, the price of even salt and pepper seems to have skyrocketed, because seasoning anything--say, a burger, or the meatloaf, seems to be a thing of the past.

The beers: A decent, small, selection. But the last two times I was there the staff hadn't cleaned the tap lines in a while, and the beers tasted murky and not very pleasant.

Pig & Whistle needs to pull its socks up and focus a bit more.
author: Steven H.

description: Good Food Great Prices, real meaty....Gotta go again!!!...YUMS!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Idi W.

description: Nice quaint bar to hang out with the locals to socialize or catch a game. It is spacious inside which is deceiving because it looks small from the exterior. Bar food wasn't bad but I think they should have changed the frying oil sooner. Our fried calamari rings and French fries were on the dark brown side.... Need a bigger tv too.
author: Joe K.

description: Horrible food, poor service, and creepy staff.  I stopped by here with friends before going to a show at the Fillmore for Valentine's.  The bar staff ignored us and wouldn't take our order because we were a group of women.  One staff member (owner? manager? Obviously someone of authority) began creeping on me and trying to get my number.  He even made a "joke" about there being a peephole in the bathroom after I came out from it.  Would never come here again.
author: Jessica Anne S.

description: This place really captures the essence of "No Frills" english pub grub. We ordered the Shepherd's Pie and Fish and Chips. Both were excellent.  The Fried Mushrooms are the Bomb.  To top it off they have Boddington's Bitter on tap.  We definitely will be back
author: John S.

description: Great Burger..  Friendly neighborhood regulars kind of place in the afternoon.
author: John W.

description: This place is terrible. Bartender can't even make an old fashion. What kind of bar is this??
author: Veronykah A.

description:
If you're looking for a British Pub in America.  The Pig & Whistle is what you're looking for.  Genuine fish and chips, bangers, British breakfast, cornish pasties better than I tasted in the UK.  No kidding!
Happy hours and food plates are great deals!  There are TVs showing soccer, golf, rugby and other sports but be careful, it can get packed during big matches.
If you're looking for a place to meet, P-Dub is a great place to start!
Street parking gets tougher as it gets later.
author: Pablo R.

description: I hadn't been there for a while and returned for fish and chips. Inconsistent food quality. The fish had a hard, crusty batter that wasn't good, the chips were cold and soggy and the sickly white tartar sauce had no flavor. Tables and chairs were sticky, in need of a good cleaning. All food prices were increased, but menus with the old prices were still on the tables. Not a welcoming atmosphere, with foul-mouthed older men at the bar and the usual assortment of unfriendly USF students.
author: Pam J.

description:
Today, still wanted by the government, He survives as a soldier of fortune. If you have a problem, if no one else can help, and if you can find him, maybe you can hire... This A gent.

It is rumored that the P+W is the best place to start looking....
author: Christopher N.

description:
I love pub atmospheres and this place fits the comfy, homey, hide-out-from-the-rain-and-wind-down craving. 

Highly recommend showing up for happy hour from 4-6pm, pints are $3 (Guinness $3.5).  You place all orders at the bar; there's a lot of seating throughout the pub; and three TVs for the sports fans. 

My one negative: the curry fries were not for me.  It's thick cut fries (which were really satisfying) drenched in a paste-like sauce that has curry powder, turmeric maybe?, and other spices mixed in (not so satisfying).  

Besides that Pig & Whistle wins if you are in the area and need a little bit of pub-lovin in your life.
author: Kimya P.

description:
Went there to get a drink with a friend and to catch the Thurs night NFL game.  Looks like there were only people older than 40 years.  Which is fine, but we were looking for a mix.  

Just had a quick drink and went to look for another spot.  Drink prices where great and selection was a good variety.
author: Jorge C.

description:
I came here with two friends around the time their happy hour was closing up and the atmosphere here is fantastic!

The dimly lit yet not romantic lights, the cedar wood floors, the appropriate amount of big screen tvs (unlike most sports bars nowadays whose walls are literally innundated with them) and the modest yet well-thought out selection of draft beers makes this little pub stand out from the others you'll find in this area.

Their Happy Hour deals are pretty reasonable: $3 for any pint of beer from the tap. There aren't any food deals during Happy Hour, but the bar food here is priced reasonably enough ($4-$6) that you really don't need a discount to enjoy them better.

My friends and I didn't stay long so I didn't get to enjoy too many of their beer selection and authentic english bar food, but for the purpose we visited this place--which was for friends who hadn't seen each other in a few years to reconnect and catch up over a pitcher of beer and some curry fries--this place was more than adequate.

I'm definitely coming back here again next time I'm in the mood for some good bar food and carlsberg on tap!
author: Scott S.
