description: Great food, great prices.  We were able to get a seat and actually have a conversation. Friendly bartenders and great bar, would definitely visit again. Food was good and they know who to pour a good beer.
author: J B.

description: Awesome guys and awesome prices! Plus trivia night is tons of fun. Love this place.
author: Alexander M.

description:
A solid pub, with a good variety of reasonably priced drinks and food, and a trivia guy you can't understand for the life of you.

I had the shepherd's pie, which was cooked nicely, and had pretty good flavor.  My friend's bangers and mash was good also,  really tasty sausage.  The trivia was eccentric and fast paced, which was entertaining. 

 I really wish they had a different guy reading the trivia though.  He's your typical old English bloke who you can't understand 2 words out of every sentence he says.  More than once I just wanted to yell at him "Speak English!"  

On top of that he had at least one trivia question that was just wrong: "Which vowel isn't an element in the periodic table."  He couldn't name an element that started with A, then just said the answer was E.  When I asked him what element was A he said, "look it up" "I did, there isn't one"....then he walks away.  Pretty lame.  All in all though, trivia was fun.

I had a good time here, and I would come back any time.
author: Dave S.

description: Great for a late night pint. Gets quite crowded on Wednesdays and Sundays for trivia. Good food, good prices and good portions. Jukebox hasn't been updated in years but still decent. The bartenders are great (Jerry is the best). Totally recommended.
author: Ron D.

description:
I had been to Pig & Whistle a couple times when I first moved to SF, and for no good reason it kind of just fell of my radar and I hadn't been back in quite sometime.

Well, about a week ago a friend of mine (who had also fallen of my radar) suggested meeting up here for drinks and after hanging out for a couple hours I came to the realization that I've been an idiot for completely neglecting this place (it's less than a 10 min. walk from my house!).

There's really nothing overly special about the place, but it's just a good solid pub.  They serve beer, wine, & liquor at reasonable prices, so that's a plus.  They also serve pub food, which I've never actually tried (I've nibbled on some friends fries) but it looks yummy and is also reasonably priced.  the bartenders are nice & efficient, another plus.  The place can get crowded, but there's a lot of places to sit, so I like that as well.  

If you're into trivia they do it on Wednesday (which happened to be the day when I was there last).  I didn't participate, but it sounded like fun.  Anyway, there's not too much to say about this place other than it's a good solid place to drink.  I'm a fan!
author: George A.

description:
Please note: This review is STRICTLY about TRIVIA NIGHT on Wednesdays.

I wasn't a huge fan. I like the host. He is chill and funny, and I appreciate how he went through the round pretty fast. BUT, he left SO much time in between each round that it took FOREVER! We started at 830pm, and by 10:45pm we hadn't even finished the last round! I was really tired so we had to go...

The questions were good, and I like the "Tshirts & Beer" round where he asks a question and goes around the bar until someone answers correctly. Then he gives them either a Tshirt or a free beer. lol

So pretty good trivia night, but wish it was shorter!
author: Gina R.

description: I've been going here for 7 years on and off now and it's probably the best bar in the city for just chilling out and relaxing with some friends over some good beer and good (for a bar) food. Everyone's really friendly and up for a chat. This also means that the bartenders will sometimes take some extra time talking to other patrons instead of servicing you right away but you get the same treatment when its your turn.
author: Ellard Matthew L.

description: Love this place.  Has a very friendly and local feel to it.  Typically Brit Pub food- Fish & Chips are very good here.  Have been here a few times now and will definitely go back next time in SF.
author: C R.

description: Came to pig and whistle this evening for the first time. I really wanted to try the Shepherd's Pie, and it was awesome! Really tasty, piping hot, great veggies, amazing presentation. I really like this place the people are friendly and it just had a nice overall feel. I'll be coming more often to try of their food.
author: Travis B.

description: BEST FISH & CHIPS outside of the UK !  Skip the Wharf and ALL other SF touristy options and head to the Pig if you want the REAL thing!  None better, freshly prepared and when your dish arrives at your table YOU will thank me...YES I'm that confident!  You can pay double or triple the price in many locations around The City, but they can't compare to this perfection!  It's ALL in the BATTER fried just right to crispy perfection!  Love the owner and bartenders, it's a COOL vibe here...so PLEASE don't turn it into a hipster hangout!  It's a real old school PUB with the best GRUB...you're WELCOME!
author: Nene H.

description: Relaxed, clean little pub-atmosphere. The menu is fairly small, which is a downside, and it's a little pricey for no-frills bar food. Luckily, the portions are large and the staff is really happy and friendly.
author: Cecilia A.

description: The food was okay. Not really good, just okay. Looks like a fun place, especially to take a group to play trivia to.
author: Heather R.

description: I've only gone here on a Wed for trivia night. Starts at 830pm but Id say have someone come at 7pm to have a table. Not overly crowded and obnoxious. And the questions are medium range difficult. I love how they have a round of music where they play a short clip of the song and you identify the artist.  Plus he announcer has the most majestic voice. The service is fantastic. Everyone has been incredibly nice and accommodating even though it was extremely busy. I highly recommend this place.
author: Tammy N.

description:
2 tvs. no sports package. and they only care about baseball.
I came in and asked them to turn on a Sharks PLAYOFF game, while a regular season baseball game was on and they said okay....20 MINUTES they still hadnt turned the game on so my boyfriend asked again, and they said only when the baseball game is done.
REALLY?
NO.
author: Yana B.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. What a pub to have in your neighborhood! I do not even live in the neighborhood but boy do I wish I did!

The folks that own/run the place are great and the food is what I would want/expect from a local pub. Great selection of beers have a fantastic happy hour. While I do not live in the neighborhood I would most certainly make a trip to The Pig & Whistle. 

Sit at the bar and enjoy a nice pint and have a conversation with the bartender and you will for sure make this a frequent place to visit.
author: Ryan B.

description: The place to go for a proper pint (or 20 oz) of Guiness and bangers!
author: Jason H.

description:
Pretty chill place if you're looking to just kick back and relax. Some TVs to watch sports and a dart board in the back.. 

The pricing of this sport is what sold me though. An order of chicken nuggets, an order of chicken wings, and two tequila sunrises for 20.50? Oh, and patron shots were 5 bucks each too! WHAT?!?!!? Yea, I'm definitely coming back. *Nods head*
author: Chau T.

description: My favorite English pub in SF - Love the atmosphere here! Simple pub style menu and great beer selection
author: Nick M.

description: Guinness + Banger & Mash + Fried Mushrooms = yum-o.  However, my boyfriend ordered the pork chops = yucky...No flavor, no color, just blua!  But I don't know if  I need to try anything else but I will have to drag a girlfriend with me next time.
author: Linda W.

description:
I stopped here after work to meet some friends and watch the rest of the Giants game - and my oh my was I impressed. I was actually surprised that I've never been here before. It's a great place to grab a beer (I would reccomend the hand-pulled IPA. TASTY!) and maybe a quick bite. Just a cool place to hang out and have a good time.

I will definitely be returning :)
author: Sara K.

description:
Over the past few years, The Pig has become my Cheers. I come here for a Kronenburg or Old Speckled Hen and a lovely chat about the economy or Manchester United game. I rather enjoy the the jalapeno poppers, Shepard's pie, and curry fries on the appetizer menu. I love the pour sizes http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/4kMOqgs0Uw-lva507RiWJg/l, Paul, Jenny, Liza, Chris, Steve, and crew. 

And I love it that despite the fact that they try to inebriate me enough so I super model diet all over the curb, I still want to come back.
author: Jason C.

description:
We were here last night and I loved it so much. It's totally one of my new favorite SF places. I got the shepherd's pie, which was am-ah-zing, and a Strongbow. My husband got the pork chops and a Boont Amber, and our friend got the fish and chips with an Anchor Steam. We all scarfed our food. I couldn't quite finish mine because it was a really decent size. It's finishable though, I could've if I was paying attention to whether I was full or not. You order at the bar and they bring the food out to you. Prices are great, for all that for the three of us it came to $40. The ambience was great, it's just the perfect kind of comfortable pub. We arrived at about 7:15 on a Saturday and it wasn't busy. We had our choice of tables.
Oh, and they have this awesomely convenient door around the side of the building that opens right into their back hallway where the bathrooms are, so when you leave and walk around the corner and then go, "oh man, I should've gone to the bathroom," - voila! There's an easy access door right there! Way to go, guys.
author: Erin A.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night. There was no interesting game on, and the atmosphere was pretty mellow.  

It was a good place to chat and hang out. The liquor made was pretty good, and I have to say they have a decent selection of beer on tap, for a good price.  The bartender was nice and friendly, and quickly got our orders. Yay!

I'm a bit odor-phobic, and the first thing I noticed when I sat down was a sour-ish, sweat smell. ICK.  I think my nose adjusted to it after a while, but its still not great.  Thats my biggest disappointment. I think I'd give it a 3.5, but not quite a 4. Maybe if I came by for trivia some time...hurm...
author: Lily W.

description: Love this place for good people and a wonderful pint! Enjoy the relaxing ambiance and make some new friends!! You'll be happy you rolled by!!!
author: Michael H.

description:
FINALLY got a chance to try this place and can't say enough good things about it. 

- Good size.  Not huge, but rarely fills up too.  
- Awesome beer selection.  
- Great food.  As Ting mentions, it makes Martin Macks look like Burger King
- Reasonable prices
- Bonuses - Pool take and quiz night.  Haven't tried either but plan to

I only wish I lived a bit closer, otherwise this would be my "goto" spot to eat, hang out, and watch the game.
author: John H.

description:
Impressive list of beer and friendly bar tenders. I couldn't decide what to drink, so he made a few suggestions and gave me a couple samples until I could figure it out. I don't remember what I ordered, but I wasn't disappointed. 

As I was waiting for my date I found myself in the middle of a conversation with a few locals at the bar. Everything about this place was friendly and welcoming, but still seemed like a comfortable place to have a quiet beer after a long day at work.

FYI: They no longer have pool tables, as some of the other reviews suggest. The bar tender said they removed them to make room for more seating in the back. You're not completely out of luck, though, since Family Billiards is right next door. So have a few drinks and then step next door to play some pool.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Top 3 reasons I love this place...

1.  You are not a bar full of indie hipsters!  
2.  For a great price, you can get your fill of a huge selection of beer on tap AND fish and chips or shepherd's pie.
3.  Can I just reiterate how affordable you are?  I think for 5 people who drank and ate our fill, we only knocked back like $80 with a nice tip?
author: Christine K.

description:
A very laid back bar.

Easy parking. Cheap Drinks. Plenty of seating. A Pool table, pin ball machine and darts in the back of the bar. 

Pig & Whistle is definitely a great alternative from the other bars on Geary.

I never tried the food but I love the fact the bartender made a little three leaf clover on my Guinness beer.

Me: HOW DID YOU DO THAT?
Bartender: *shh* its a secret
Me: *still have bewilder look*
author: Carol Y.

description: It's the local drinking hole or dive, whichever your prefer.  Cheap drinks, decent spot, what's not to like
author: Dilly M.

description:
Large selection of beers on tap, TV's a plenty for the inner and outer Bay Area sports fan.  Walls full of photos and interesting nick nacks.  Time to get your eats on with British pub food.

Bangers and Mash baby!
So come on down and wet your whistle here.

Decor:5
Food:4
Service:4

Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!
author: Kelson H.

description:
Came here after a friend's birthday. They had a trivia event on a Sunday. We came towards the end, but it seemed fun. They give you a drink ticket if you answer them correctly. 

I ordered a drink here, but what I initially thought it to be was different. The bartender was kind enough to give it to me for free. 

The bartenders are friendly and they have a back room with a small pool table, a pin ball machine, and one of those puzzle game machines. They have several tables to just sit and relax and a big projection screen.

I'd come back to try their grub!
author: Mandy D.

description: Nice and enjoyable place. Cool pub with a chill/relaxed crowd. I got the fish n' chips, and they were fresh and piping-hot. They have a decent selection of beers on tap, so you'll have a great time trying them all out!!
author: Derek N.

description: For the idiots who forgot this is a pub where they play a different kind of football on LOL.... and what not.  I've been to London many times and I felt like I stepped back in London while here (which is a good thing).  The guy that served us was English for sure and was very friendly.  The English breakfast I ordered was so tasty.  It was missing the fried tomatoes and black pudding I love about their breakfasts, but overall really tasty along with a pint of beer was great.  The pub was also amazingly clean for a pub, probably cleaner than all of the ones I've been in in the UK... LOL.  Great establishment and I will go here again probably in 2 months when my friends from London get homesick LOL. =)
author: John H.

description: So this place loves their baseball. Who cares? This spot is fun... And that's all you need for a drink. Bartenders are nice!
author: Denise H.

description: Many regulars and the bartender knows customers over many years.  The food is good -- it does come to you piping hot.  The Guinness does taste better -- the bartender said they sell a lot, so that's the reason.
author: Dan C.

description:
Nice pub!

I was on my way home from my friend's place when I had a hankering for fish n chips. I went in and ordered a Stella, and the aforementioned. I'm not a social person. I just wanted fish n chips. So, I go sit at a table, take out my book, and start reading.

20 minutes goes by. I look around hopefully. A guy brings fish n chips and a burger to the table next to me.

30 minutes go by. I am annoyed but still trying to enjoy my book.

40 minutes go by. Arrrg, I'm going to have to say something. I don't like saying things, even when it's required. Like I said, I'm not very social. I prefer writing on the internet.

So I go and ask the lady about the food. I wasn't upset or anything. I've worked in the restaurant business before and I realize shit happens. She was actually way more upset about her mistake than I was, and insisted on comping the meal. I was so pleased by her commitment to customer service that I tipped her twice!

I actually didn't love the fish n chips. The fries here are really delicious, and they do give you a rather large portion, but the fish itself is absolutely swimming in grease. Get it? Swimming? But, the service has earned them a new loyal customer, so I will have be back to try some of their other dishes.
author: Rachel H.

description: I'm a big fan of this place - decently priced food, good sized portions, reminds of England... tick tick tick on the checklist. All the staff are super friendly and will take good care of you. There's even the group of old timers talking about football and getting loud at the end of the bar, although they made the bartender cry one time because of a lost credit card slip.
author: Andy A.

description:
The perfect neighborhood pub, with pretty good food.  I recommend the fish and chips, with extra chips and malt vinegar.  Some damn good eatin'.  The bartender made me a Long Island and I was knocked on my keester.  Ah, the power of not enough food in my belly before a stiff pour.

The trivia night is just okay.  Some bars you go to and people are not only totally into it, there's serious competition between regulars.  The trivia at P&W is more like a sidebar to drinking.  

Although I liked the old pool table, I'm glad they now have more seating in the back.  It was small, anyway, and you'd practically hit the cue on the wall for some shots.
author: Tamar D.

description: Good English food... and proper Fish & Chips! Nice laid back local pub.
author: Nicholas B.

description: My mum's from the UK so I have visited frequently. This place reminded me of many of the pubs back in the UK and the Fish and Chips along with the curry do the UK justice.
author: Graham H.

description:
The bartender said, "$16."
I thought he said, "$60."

Both are ridiculous for three drinks, but its better to be ridiculously cheap than ridiculously expensive.  And that is how the rest of the night went.  Cheers!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I can't tell you how thrilled I was to see they have Cornish pasties on the menu. That and a quiz? What more can you ask. Brown sauce, oh wait, they have that AS WELL!  

Quiz is good fun, not as formal as the Brainstorrmer League, but the quizmaster is a riot and the $2.50 quiz special for Sierra Nevada and Kronnberg is okay in my book.   Oh yeah and they have cricket and lawn bowls team.  This the most legit English bar I've been to in SF.
author: Raka D.

description:
Dear Pig and Whistle,

I know we just recently started seeing each other, especially after my long days and weekends of class.  You never cease to disappoint me or ever make me sad.  Truly, tonight, after a weekend with 11 hours of class - almost nonstop - you've made me one tremendously happy soul.

First and foremost, one of the wonderful men working there yelled at some guy for peeing all over the toilet seat.  Thank you for trying to preserve the sanctity of one's trip to the toilet.

Second and best of all, I celebrated the GIANTS' WIN into the WORLD SERIES with my beloved classmates and fellow happy strangers.

Another happy note, a random British stranger was so ecstatic that he picked up my 6' basketball player classmate in celebration. It was quite the sight to see!

To all those fans in Philadelphia, you asked for this loss by being such bullies and this is why you waved your white towels in surrender tonight.  

To ensure that I am not a total jerk, I was legitimately concerned for Phillies' Raul Ibanez. I thought he had taken his molars out and playing with a swollen face, which would be bad, but clearly, that was not the case.


Thank you Pig and Whistle. To the many days I will see you again.

Love,
Me


P.S. 4-6 pm Happy Hour DAILY! $3 - $4 beers.
author: Dolores L.

description: This is definitely my favorite laid-back, neighborhood niche.  The beer is good (and happy hour is probably the best I've seen in the city $$-wise), it's a typical pub, so don't expect to go in minks and heels, in the very least you'll get a crooked eye, and at worst the patrons might just toss you out for being ridiculous. :)  That said, the atmosphere is friendly/ jibe-humor.  Trivia night is a can't miss.  And, if you want one helluva good Bloody Mary that doesn't break the bank-- head over on Sunday around brunch time, get yourself a full English Breakfast and a Bloody.  You won't be disappointed.   If you're out in the evening-- get the jalapenos poppers-- this place is one of the few bars I've been to in the city that actually does them right.
author: Ami L.

description:
I like to win.  I particularly like to win pub trivia, because it combines beer and knowing stuff.  (After 7 years of higher education, I'd like to think I know some stuff.)

So Pig & Whistle's Wednesday trivia night (8:30pm) is one of my favorites - and the fact that my teammates and I have won every time we've gone there doesn't hurt. :D  (Last night's team name?  An Almost-Lawyer Walks Into A Bar.  Ba-dum SWISH)

I like that they do two rounds before collecting the scorecards and tallying.

Plus, they having drink specials during trivia - last night featured $2.50 Sierras - which helps the knowledge (or the wild guesses) flow.  Their pub food is pretty standard - I'd skip the fries and fried mushrooms, but the onion rings are really good - and fairly inexpensive.

There are two drawbacks: trivia night is PACKED, so it takes forever to tally up scores, and trivia night is PACKED, so you have to get there an hour early if you want a table.  

On second thought, maybe you shouldn't go at all.  Maybe you should stay home.  Yeah... that's it.
author: Jennie K.

description:
As part of my sister's month long birthday celebration, we stopped into the Pig & Whistle for a drink, a few Grey Goose & tonics for me & a few dirty martinis for her. Nothing is more disastrous than drinking on an empty stomach so we both sat down for a veggie burger & fries.

Sidenote:  A few years ago, their veggie patty (I don't know who the distributor was or if it was homemade) was my #1 favorite in the whole world but they have since switched to using plain ole' Gardenburger. I've searched high & low for a veggie patty that compares to the one they used to serve (hearty, flavorful, amazing) but have had no luck so far...

The Pig & Whistle is a fun English pub; great atmosphere for getting drunk & silly & making new (drunken) buddies. They've always got a game on one of their numerous tvs, a pool table in the back, trivia night on wed & sun evenings (it gets super competitive) & the bartenders are very friendly. And parking is pretty easy-either right on the side of the building or one block over.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Drinks = mostly beers.  Will make mixed drinks, but you had to enlighten them on the ingredients.  
Plenty of parking.
Decent prices.
Has pub food.
Has happy hour...which brings all of the college kids.

That's about it.  Not bad, not spectacular either.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I love this bar!

The food is good.  The bartenders are wonderful.  The patrons... 

depends whether or not I'm there.  ;)

It's within stumbling distance of home, and it's all down hill from there if you know what I mean.

They have an insane quiz night with all kinds of specials.  I am a fan.
author: Theron L.

description:
I outsmarted my BF, yes I did.  I tricked him in to taking me out on a school night.  Yes, I did.  And, then he tricked me with a drink that was alcoholic, yes he did.  

We came here as a mini-celebration.  Mini-celebutant celebration.  It was around 7pm and though I had secretly indulged in Happy Hour downtown near school before I took the bus home, I ordered and ate some more.  This bollywood dance and sculpting class is burning calories!

BF go the Cornish Pastie (which ironically came with a green salad that was tasty and delicious)
Erica got the Fish and chips (which was a HUGE serving on a bed of chips)
I got the chicken wings (which appeared on their "lighter fare and appetizers menu" for $4.59 but was a large a serving as the fish and chips.
Beers all around except for me, who had a mickey slipped into my drink by my own beloved.  I'm writing this through a hangover the size of your mom.

The crowd was very chill.  They liked being here, but it wasn't "who they were."  They were pub and beer people but being a patron of the Pig did not make them feel like superior human beings.  They engaged in conversations without making it appear as though they were blessing you with the pearls of wisdom that fell from their mouths.  Chill.

The "booth" we sat in was terrific.  The side against the wall was cushioned with green velvet.  And there were little arm rests that delineated where the next section was.  I had my own little throne, that I had to share with Erica.  

The food came and was pretty good.  The fried stuff was all about the same color of well done.  I think it's a british thing because every pub I've been to has done the same violence to fried foods.  It's like the time was set to "make sure there's nothing left alive."

My wings were seasoned to perfection and fried to a crisp.  It came with 3 dipping sauces.  I like dipping.  And I like sauces.  And it came with the same salad that was oddly delicious.  

Erica's fish was good.  It's fish.  I don't know how else to describe it.  I would have eaten it.

BF's pastie was surprisingly tasty.  It had ground meat, peas, seasoning and a flaky pasty all around.  LIke a messy, non-hand-held pie that you eat with a knife and fork.  

CHECK: another one off my list that my BF never thought I would take him to.  Because he thinks I have something up my sleeve.  And I do.  It's armpit hair.
author: Christina C.

description: Great relaxed atmosphere and the food and prices weren't bad for a pub.
author: Anonymous C.

description:
I absolutely love this place. After moving to SF three years ago from the UK, I was searching for ages for a decent pub that had nice pub food and good atmosphere. I found exactly this in the Pig and Whistle. They have a lovely selection of British/Irish/European beers -- including Old Speckled Hen ale (yum yum). Lots of pub food including full English Breakfast, Steak and Ale pie (with beans and chips...so authentic!!), Fish and Chips (the best I've had in SF) and bar snacks like curry chips and breaded mushrooms. And well stocked in HP sauce and British malt vinegar (yum yum).

Also, the atmosphere is really great. Lots of regulars go, it has a pool table and darts, and there are often themed nights that quiz night (lots of fun...pretty challenging questions!) and things like that. The dukebox has loads of British classics...The Beatles, Oasis, Blur, Maniacs, Pulp, you name it....

Basically, it's a top home-from-home for expats, and a little British experience for Americans! I've spent many a happy hour reminiscing with Brits about nights out in Sheffield as well as sharing tips like where to find orange squash in the Bay Area. As us Yorkshire lasses say "It's really brilliant!!!"
author: Sarah F.

description:
I went to this place not expecting anything great, but it wasn't actually that bad.  The crowd looked like they were regulars so they kinda looked at my group like they knew we were new the joint, but whatever ... we shrugged them off and went right in.

I was already really drunk before getting here, but felt like I could take on a few more drinks.  The prices of their drinks are very fair and strong.  

The bartenders was very very nice, funny, and concerned.  He kept an eye on me to see if I was going to "eat it" -- LOL.  He also kept the water coming.

The place itself looked like your average very chill bar ... not all "glamed" up inside or anything.

If I just want a place to drink that's nearby, that I could even go to in my sweats, then this is where I'd go =).
author: Pia V.

description:
Pig and the Whistle, you're f'n brilllllllll-yant!!!
Fun crowd, very yummy pub grub!  The bartenders are a riot, groovy juke box, pool table...it's packed on the weekends and completely conducive to wacky hi-jinks (to that guy singing along to the Spice Girls on Saturday, I love you!!!  ("Tell me what you want...what ya really really want and ziggy zig zigahhhhh!!! (~_~)  Parking can be tricky but usually no more than 1 block away...also near Muni stops AND there's a jillion cabs whizzing by on Geary anywho!!!

During the week it's still fun, just less populated...and the Quiz nights are great too, well run, etc..

A SOLID 5 STARS!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Karen S.

description:
Only went here once, but it was a good time!  Granted half the great time is the company you're with, but still, this was a solid little bar.

Good vibe, good drinks. The pub food is nothing to write home about. The fish and chips are very very bland, but the fries are massive so I guess it evens out. I heard from others at the table that the Banger Rolls are to die for. 

We had an easy time getting a table for 7 on a Saturday evening and spent several hours having drinks and conversation. The staff were hard working and friendly, and I just loved the pub vibe. I would love to come back for trivia night, too. 

Definitely worth a look!
author: Evey G.

description: The Pig has a special place in my heart. Let me start with Jerry you're the coolest cat in town with out a doubt. Me and my buddy only come in when Jerry is around so this is more a review on him, and quite frankly the dudes the tits! More on the food and drink. typical bar food, cheap greasy, exactly why you need. I've also come for breakfast pretty good bangers and mash, I've had better fish and chips but not bad at all. The beer selection is not huge but it has a bit of something for everyone, which is a hard thing to pull off but they do ti with ease, additionally they make a good fuckin' cocktail just the way i like em good and strong, yet delicious. Again a tip of the hat to Jerry. Its a great spot to get a bite relax and drink. Needless to say i'll be back soon.
author: Sean MC E.

description:
Well met, stranger.  What beseech you this fine hour?  Upon the moonlight you seek old tales of glory? 

For the Alliance!
author: Margaret S.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday and thought it was a really neat local joint. Drinks are cheap - cocktails and shots are about $5. Bartenders are friendly. It's a smaller pub, bar but they have a back room with a billiards table so it's nice if your group can take it over. 

Haven't tried any of the food but the group nibbled on the usual bar food/fried goodness. It's casual and fun.
author: Jane C.

description: divey, good beer prices, great happy hour prices, typical english pub food--decent and probably better when drunk.
author: Stella H.

description:
I love the bar food. Expect to pay about $10

Ordered the bangers and mash.
Drinking buddy ordered the fish and chips. He said the fish tasted kind of "off". We'll see what happens to him in 48 hours *LOL*
Libations: Boddingtons

It was packed and very loud but it was a Friday night so... 

We made a rookie mistake and thought someone would take our order. After 20 minutes we decided to flag down a staff member who was on his way out the door.  He told us we had to order at the front and pointed to the directions ON THE MENU!  How embarrassing for the both of us. I'm not afraid to admit my mistake. =P

We didnt hang out too long due to the noise and wanted to catch up so we headed up to Abbey Tavern.

This place looks fun and I will definitely return with a few more people.
author: Sun T.

description: Sadly, I have to say, I agree with some of the other reviewers on here. Was really looking forward to some british food: chips and curry, heinz beans, etc. but it was just a-ok. The service made it a bit worse. I don't think the bartender is very happy. A bit of a disappointment as we drove out of our way to go here.
author: Phoebe J.

description:
Whoot for trivia night and whoot for free drinks if you play the trivia night.  I'm unsure if they always pass out free drink cards.  It was really slow tonight and there were not many people in the bar.  I think it's because V-D is tomorrow and a lot of people were trying to beat the rush.

A ton of fun and the host is awesome.  He's very funny and very entertaining.
author: Ashley I.

description:
The food is god, and fairly authentic (I'm British, so I know) , certainly better than a lot of the crap they try to pass off as British food. The Beer they have on tap is a good selection, although I am a bit hurt that American beers still rule the roost.... If you want bud there are urinals out the back. 

Still a fun night and a little taste of home
author: Adam K.

description:
the pool table is no more.  breaking my heart, pig & whistle.  

i unfortunately have no reason to see you anymore (since pubs are a plenty) unless a group of friends want to make the trip.

sigh.
author: Ting A.

description: Super rude dark haired man.. food is just fried... nothing special
author: X S.

description:
A good solid spot. Good place to hang with friends. 

I was up for a weekend in SF visiting some friends of mine. This is just one stop on the list of places we went to. I was hanging out with a bunch of Irish folk and made the mistake of trying to keep up with them. Don't ever try that!

The bar manager/owner remembered my name the second time he saw me. And they've a pool table in back. Can't complain. Food is supposed to be nice, but I didn't try it.
author: Lynn C.

description:
For over three years the Pig & Whistle was my home away from home. Back in the UK I used to joke that one day I'd find a bar where I could have my own stool, just like Norm from Cheers. The Pig & Whistle is the closest I've ever got to realizing that dream, but in the end I settled for friendships with some of the nicest bar staff I've ever met, the best-poured pints of Boddingtons I've found in the Bay Area to date, great trivia nights on Wednesdays and Sundays, proper English pub food, a pool table that rarely gets overly busy, and a dartboard that's only occasionally life-threatening. In short, I settled for a bar that was everything I needed from a bar, and more.

I've had so many great times at the Pig & Whistle that trying to talk about just one experience here would be impossible. I used to go on my own a lot after work because I knew that I'd always end up befriending someone or, failing that, having a great time with whoever was working that night. Steve the landlord even took me seriously when I suggested that he offer HP Sauce (an A1-beating taste of England) with the food there, which is worth a star in itself.

Your mileage may vary, of course, and I'm sure that my experiences aren't typical. I can't imagine anyone having anything but a good time here though, especially if they have a penchant for English beers, English cooking, or (admit it) English accents.
author: Justin C.

description: I prefer to rate businesses on both their product and service, but neither were available when I walked in to this place.  My girlfriend and I sat down at the bar and there were only 6 people in there from what I could see.  We waited for quite a while to get glance from one of the three staff people on that night, but no dice. Point taken, we left. Cool looking place in a nice area, but the sketchy pool bar next door would have been more welcoming.
author: A.D. R.

description: euro-style pub.  probably a fantastic place to spend a hungover sunday, but i haven't done that yet.  went in after lunch on a weekday and it was basically empty.  it wasn't crowded, but lots of euro folks in general.  i felt a lot like i had been magically transported back to europe to a hole-in-the-wall.  food was awful.   nevermind, i think the fries were okay.  but anyhow, point is that when i was there the ambience was great!
author: maria f.

description:
- Prices are great
- The lighting is good, ambient but not so dim that you have to squint to talk to the people you're with.
- food's pretty awesome
- haven't been to trivia night, but heard tons about it, so I'll check that out on next wednesday.
author: Rani M.

description:
Excellent pub that reminded me of London (except for the chicken tikka masala which was on the menu, lol) 

Great beer, great people.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Best fish-n-chips ever!
enough said.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Due to certain machinations of my personal life as of late, I've found myself in the Pig and Whistle quite often, and as far as SF "pubs" go, it's a keeper. It's one of those bars you can be drinking in at 2:30 in the afternoon and you feel like you're accomplishing something. I need to make a category for that; "Nice-day-out-mid-afternoon-drinking-bar."

Over in this area there are a few English / Irish style pubs and this is one of the nicer ones. Not only do they have a pretty decent selection of beers, they have some pretty decent pub food. I have never had an order of fish and chips bigger than the one I got here at the Pig and Whistle. 

You can tell that the place is a fairly consistent regular's bar. They've typically got sports (most often the 'footy') up on the TVs, there's pool in the back and, oh yeah, there's trivia there at least one night a week I think. 

I've spoken to a few real, authentic, British people who have told be that they enjoy the place so that's got to tell you something. The old wood chairs, wood bar, lots of pints, fish and chips. You get the idea.
author: Andy A.

description: I like this place. My friend brought me here for pub quiz. Fun stuff. Little crowded, small space, but friendly people. Bartender was a little weird, she couldn't believe the age on my ID and it was a little embarrassing. Seems like an SF state hangout. Good happy hour. It's actually not to horrendous finding a parking spot on the street, but it could be just the weekday nights.
author: Naomi K.

description:
I went here years ago for a first date.  We had a couple of drinks and played pool in the back room.  

Fast forward to present time.  Hey, they serve food here!  I came here with some work chums and had ourselves some fish and chips.  The portions are large and we barely finished our lunch.  The fried mushrooms were very good and so are the fries.  I got the veggie burger, what can i say, it was a veggie burger.  Oh, and they serve non alcoholic beer.  Interesting.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Fullers London Pride on tap, curry fries, Chris behind the bar and soccer on TV, what more can you want?  Oh, trivia, then go on a Tuesday or Sunday, but your keep your whispers down to a shout.  But I wouldn't order the calamari...
author: OhTheRogue S.

description:
british food and i do not go well together.
the beer, however, is a much different story.

had the curry fries, sausage rolls, and chicken curry with mango chutney.

the curry fries were inedible (even though I ate it all anyway).  the curry sauce could not even be called curry in any sense.  after having curry from many other southeast asian, japanese, indian, bengali, and pakistani cuisines, I could not let this tasteless, spiceless yellow muck be considered curry.  all it did was sog the fries with no benefits to the flavor department.  no spice at all, absolutely none.  we ended up drenching the batch in the malt vinger, salt, and ketchup (which were all provided on the table).  i dont even like salt and was forced to use quite a bit to make this dish taste like anything other than pasty, soggy potatoes.

the sausage rolls were very good.  i was expecting something like whole sausage in a bun, but this was more like minced sausage meatballs inside a tasty, flaky roll.  very reminiscent of pate chaud.  6 rolls lined the perimeter of the dish while a nice mixed salad with a light dressing complemented the inner center.  a nice, tasty dish, an impeccable addition to the tasty beer we had.

The chicken curry with mango chutney was uninspiring.  first off, we had the same exact sauce that came with the fries, so you already know how that story goes.  we hoped as chicken, it would at least give out a taste, ANY taste, but guess what? it was just...soggy tasteless chicken.  they successfully replaced the fries with chicken, added some poorly cooked rice (ricecooker anyone?), cold naan, and a tiny paper saucecup of mango chutney, slapped on a higher price tag and called it another dish.  it tasted just as bland.

mango chutney was great though.  we redistributed it to every other dish because it add a lot of flavor.  I believe we found ginger, chili, and mango pulp.  a delicious spread.

the beer was awesome, and the beer menu was very nice with generous prices.  we had two 20oz boddingtons on tap.  was foamed up nicely and went down really well with the sausage rolls.

the service was excellent, and the nice pub feel made the experience enjoyable.  there is no waiter service, you just order from the bar and bring your food back to the table if that's where you're sitting.

i would like to say that i really want to come back and try the other dishes to give this place a second chance but....with so so many good restaurants out in the area alone, let alone the rest of san francisco, i dont think i can make any promises.
author: Christopher N.

description:
A jolly fine pub if I do say so myself.

The bartenders are delightfully nice and somehow seem to be quick even when the bar is packed.

A decent selection of whiskey if it's not a beer night coupled with some super comfortable seating to rest that tired buttocks of yours.

And if the conversation of friends gets stale, you can always enjoy some darts, pool, or video touch games.

Last but not least, the fish and chips are some of the best I've had. Fresh huge slabs of fishies, lightly fried with all the fixins. I can imagine there being a better fish & chip but I've yet to find it
author: Victor B.

description: Fun athmosphere especially during pub quiz night. Food is mediocre, but I guess it's really the beer and camaraderie that you go for.
author: Farah S.

description: This place is super loud and big enough for you to squeeze in your group at least on a Wednesday night out.  The beer is $4 a glass.  not bad at all.  And best thing is there is wifi.
author: Byron L.

description:
i dont know if its just me but every time i come here, i always run into these crazy, old irish bastards (i meant that in a good way)
the beer selection is ok, ur usual stella, guinness,etc
drinks are good, but ive been to cheaper bars, the food is alright at best (ive had their fries, wings and nachos)
but without a fail, there are always some crazy irishmen tearin it up in this joint
one time i was here, these 3,4 OLDASS irish dudes were gettin their drinks up, this was 1 AM on Monday...my god these guys started dancing and callin each other fags and bastards....and one of them tried to breakdance and ended up hurting his back cause he fell funny....and his friend came up to us asking if we had a bandage..."facepalm"

so watch out for these crazy, old irish men, they dont give a f**k!

3 stars
author: Michael K.

description:
[Edit: Had the fish and chips &thought it was a little pricey, but when it actually came out, i knew it was totally worth the 9 dollars. They weren't little fish sticks, they were really big fish fillets! Fries were nothing special, didn't even finish them 'cause I was too focused on the fish!]

Went here last night with a bunch of my classmates after a big event. I love how it's only a short walk from school. I had a blast, and the staff was definitely really cool. Didn't have a chance to try their food, but when I asked them about it (my friend really, really needed something to eat), they kindly told me they had food right next door that I could bring back in. AND they made sure they checked on my friend who was having a really, REALLY good time.

Nice staff. Typical bar ambiance. Good folks. Good night! Definitely coming back!
author: Lisa D.

description: I do like a good beer. And Wednesday night trivia is my jam.
author: Trixie N.

description:
Pretty much the best all-around bar in the city. No pretense. No "crowd". Just well-priced drinks, attentive and friendly service, and delicious authentic British pub food. Tremendous jukebox selection as well. They have flat screens for viewing sports and a large projection screen for major sports events.

Undoubtedly the best part of the P&W, are the trivia nights on Wednesdays and Sundays. Wednesday draws the largest crowds, probably because of the Sierra drink specials. There is a different host for Wednesdays and Sundays and they are both very good, except I've caught the Wednesday host repeating rounds from previous weeks.

I'm only giving four stars, because the food certainly isn't gourmet. I don't think five-star British pub food exists, but this is as close as you'll get to it in SF. The burger, chicken nuggets, and sausage rolls are outstanding. The one time I had the bangers and mash it was slightly subpar, it seemed like the bangers were not cooked enough. Probably just a fluke.

The staff here is really incredible too. They are friendly and relaxed.

This is an all-around great little place to sit down and enjoy some food and drink with friends.
author: Dan R.

description:
Nice place to watch a big game.  I came here after work with a bunch of co-workers to watch the NCAA Championship Bball game.  It wasn't too packed which was what we were trying to avoid.  They have a HD projector which projects onto a huge screen and a couple flat screen.

They also have a dart board, pool table (75 cents per game), and Firestones Beer on tap!!!
author: Danny P.

description: $4.50 for a pint of Boddington's??? SWEET. Also, the guy next to me got a half order of fish and chips for $5 and the food filled the entire plate. Looking forward to returning.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
A bubbling yellow
Only available here
The London's Pride beer

____
I came a little out of my way to visit Pig & Whistle because they carry a unique beer called "London's Pride," which I thought was a little odd because I would've sworn it's an Irish bar, but my friend informed me its an English bar.  Whatever.  They all talk the same.

Unfortunately, London's Pride really isn't much worth bragging about.  It doesn't taste bad, but it doesn't taste good.  It's just "A-OK," as yelp would say, and that doesn't warrant a special visit.

On the plus side, they do know how to pour the Guinness and it is one of the roomier bars in the neighborhood.
author: Jin D.

description:
Where you will find my blackened fish, veggies and rice takeout:

1. On the floor of the 22, as my paper bag was leaking on the way home. As much as I desperately want to save the earth, this was one of those moments where I would have liked a plastic bag. Not a good start.

2. As part of a fish sandwich tonight.

3. On top of a spinach salad tomorrow.

4. As a veggie side later this week.

5. Replated (a bit of everything and all of th rice) for someone who needs it.

Once I got past the leak, this turned out to be a lot of good food for a very good price. Fond memories of quiz night seal the fourth star.
author: Jason B.

description: This place has awful buffalo wings.  It is an insult to call them buffalo wings.  This is false advertising.  The first thing wrong with them is that they are breaded.  Buffalo wings are not breaded, this is kfc wings.  The second problem is that they weren't even spicy.  Lame!  I will give kudos to the bar tender who deliverd them to me.  He placed them in front of me and said "here's your chicken wings".  He was smart enough to not call them buffalo wings.
author: Mr Buffalo Wings S.

description:
In the interest of candor,  have to disclose that the Pig & Whistle used to sponsor my dodgeball team.  As a result, though I can't say I feel beholden to the bar, I have spent a LOT of time there and I do have a soft spot for the place.

The P&W has all kinds of yummy fried foods - and who doesn't love fried food?  (In the interest of candor, I grew up in Wisconsin, where the deep fried Mars Bar and deep fried cheese curd were invented).  They have Shepherd's Pie which I also love (And in the interest of candor, I lived in London for half a year when I was 10, and I have a soft spot for English food - weird, I know).  

The P&W also has a great beer selection (although, in the interest of candor, I have to say I am unimpressed with the selection of *local* beers).

The P&W has a pool table, and a good juke box.  In the interest of candor - I like the place.
author: Joe C.

description:
This is the best-run trivia night I've encountered in SF -- a nice and loud announcer, a nice mix of common knowledge and current events questions, and loyal and devoted fans who are in it to win it.

Great draft selection -- Fuller's and Old Speckled Hen, for example. Footie on the telly. The food looked and smelled great, too.
author: Adam Z.

description:
This place must be handing out the BJs cuz it's VERY popular. I've been here for lunch a couple times: that's right, LUNCH. And it's pretty good. They've got a tasty-ass shepherd's pie with baked beans. A friend swears by the fish and chips: they do look fresh.

Clean and dim inside. It's TEEMING with hot Irish construction workers grabbing a pint on their lunch hour. HELLO!! Service is a little slow but maybe that's just cuz I have an hour. 

They're honest about the desserts, too. If they're not fresh, they don't recomend them. I admire their honesty.
author: Molly E.

description: Best thing I ordered was my beer , if you're coming here for British food go somewhere else, My sausage and fries tasted like they have been under a heat lamp all day but if you're looking for drinks it's a cool pub atmosphere..
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Hmm... what doesn't P&W have?  There seems to be something for everyone.  Pool table, darts, pinball, and a great jukebox.  The bartenders treat you well and you can usually find a place to sit.  P&W is our unofficial after work pub to hangout at.  Nice place to bring people not to meet new people unless you into the older crowd.

Best part about it is that Nizario Pizza is across the street (I think)  I was a little too tipsy to remember.  Damn, I forgot the bartenders name too... but I swear the place is called The Pig & Whistle.. (I think) ;0)

Update 5 minutes later:  I get a comp from Faffy that reads:

"Hehe. You must have had too much to drink at P&W cuz Nizarios is totalllly noot across the street! It's like on Geary & 2nd!"

There you have it folks... and I thought it was across the street.
author: Jamal G.

description:
(This review is specific for trivia night)

Now I am a trivia geek.  During grad school my roommates and I would watch Jeopardy and try to shout out the answers first.   We became a bit obsessed with Ken Jennings.  I think that's why my team last night thought I might be autistic.   So my complaints:

-- The quiz takes a long time.   Not that it's filled with questions mind you.   There are long, long waits in between rounds.  I was able to take time to go outside and read tomorrow's East Coast newspapers on my iPhone while waiting for the next set of questions to begin.  Also the rounds are only 8 questions long, no multi-point questions. 

-- The quizmaster forgot to say our score when announcing the standings.  This is fright inducing  because you're immediately faced with the chance that you've wasted your time due to a clerical error, and when you're trying to get the quizmaster's attention to rectify the problem the bar staff looks at you like a potential terrorist. 

-- The last round was wayyyyy too easy.  Every team in the bar got all, or all save one, right.  Consider that these people have been drinking for three hours that is absurd.  This should be the toughest round.

-- Finally, before the last round the quizmaster asks a few "extra tough" questions and gives a prize to the person who get it right.  The last question was "What was the breed of dog shown in 'The Thin Man' series?"   I know this.  I saw the movies as a kid (they are based in SF).  I even HAD A DOG OF THIS BREED as a kid.   I raise my hand and give the answer, "Fox Terrier."

"Wrong" says the quizmaster. 

What?  What?!?!?!?!?!?

He then gives the prize to some one who says "Schnauzer."  During the next interminably long break I look up wikipedia on my iPhone.  To confirm.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asta

I take my iPhone up to the quizmaster with as little drunken defiant rage as I can muster and he says "Yes, I gave the wrong answer" then turns away.  No reason why.  Lord knows how many other mistakes he makes correcting answers or tabulating scores. 

Annoying.  Where's Alex Trebeck when you need him?
author: Beau G.

description:
I'm always a sucker for these "The Blank & Blank" pub names.  The Rose & Crown, The Plough & Stars, The Leg of Mutton & Cauliflower (yes, it really exists, but not in San Francisco)...and The Pig & Whistle, which, as the Lone Bar in Lone Mountain, feels like a neighborhood bar placed on neutral ground for the whole city to enjoy.

I was hoping for a more intimate, wood-paneled, cozy-pub interior, but it's not bad, and the shanty-esque white exterior is great.  They also do pub quiz here--I found it a lot easier than the Brainstormer ones, though of course that doesn't make it any easier to win.  But no matter when the barkeep (with a classically British air of pride-in-his-work) keeps plying you with perfectly poured pints from the ample beer selection.  Didn't get a chance to try the food, but I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Wes M.

description:
eThe Pig and Whistle seems to be an English bar that tries very dilligently to be otherwise.
 
I ordered a Carlsberg and the fish and chips and within a moment of my ordering to the trashy Rene Zellweger lookalike, I was asked to pay in cash before my food was given to me.  Bizzare.  Unfortunately, the food was severely sub-par (compared to Ireland 32). 

The food service was glacial and the reaction to my being upset about it was peculiar.

"I ordered my food close to 50 minutes ago."
"Oh well sometimes food takes a bit longer when things are busy."
 
It was Wednesday and there were 5 people here.

The decor is bland and the staff is nauseatingly apathetic.  The clientele is severely yuppie (as is expected) and a drastic exaggeration to all things incorrect about neighborhood SF bars.  

Go elsewhere.
author: Rich J.

description:
Great beer.  Curry fries.  Real people.  Honest bartenders who know how to pour a Guinness!  Trivia.  Fish & chips.  Great beer.  

It's what a pub is supposed to be - casual, local, dependable.  It'll wet your whistle and satisfy your inner pig.

Careful, it can be a bit of a time trap....
author: Liz S.

description:
Came here for trivia on a Sunday night, and this place was so much fun! 

Feels like a very authentic British pub in the middle of San Francisco. Nice bartenders. Friendly crowd. Competent trivia announcer. Strongbow cider on tap. Yum.

Easy parking for my friends who drove, and easy access to transit.

Food was ok; it's pub food.  Long wait because the place was packed. Next time, I'll try the fish and chips.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Shatangi dedicates this review to the yelp 'yatches that cry about my reviews being too short.

the last time i went to the P&W was a rainy Sunday in 05. We found parking about a block and a half away. We enjoyed several hours of free billiards. The decor was tres Irlandais. Black & tan's were the beverage of choice while we enjoyed sumptuous amounts of pub grub including flaky sausage rolls with mustard and rings of onion dipped in batter and fried in oil to a greasy perfection. The pub quiz was a really good one and laughs were had by all except for one sad sad little man who had just lost his favorite aunt in a horrible cheer-leading accident. Who would have thought that being in the middle tier of the pyramid wold prove to be the most fatal position. Well I suppose there are more fatal positions like top tier to close to a low flying flock of African flamingos. But I digress. Oh wait PELICANS would be much more dangerous!!  Any-hoo

Proper pub fare, no attitude, fun crowd including pub quiz and free pool early Sunday.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I am not a bar/pub person, so I cannot comment on Pig and Whistle's beer selection. 

I went here on a Sunday night for Quiz Night with co-workers and significant others, including mine. The inside looks like what I expected from a pub - wood interior, including the furniture, paintings/pictures all over the wall, a bar, and tv's. Some of the staff even complemented the ambiance of the pub with their British accent.  

For our first time to a place like this, we had to order the fish and chips. Out comes this plate with HUGE pieces of fried fish and chips=fries. This had to be the biggest (and cheapest) order of fish and chips I have ever seen! We also ordered the buffalo wings, which were different than what I'm used to. Instead of the sauce being on the wings, you get the cooked wings served with 3 types of sauces. Others in my group also ordered food and were happy with their selections.

There was a good crowd there for Quiz Night. Some had to be regulars! What you do is get into groups of however many people you want, and form teams. There are many different rounds which involve a variety of topics such as current events, geography, a celebrity picture round, or music. It was fun to see what kinds of random facts people know! Basically which ever group can answer the most questions correctly wins a prize. That night it was $30 cash. Although I don't drink, the rest of my group surely does, so the pitchers kept coming. Good food + beer = good fun and happy people!
author: Kimberly S.

description: Have been here  few times, very loud when they have quiz nights, they don't double check the correct answers (I kind of got screwed on this when I knew the right answer but the bar had another answer).  Food is ok but nothing great.
author: Spencer S.

description: The pub quiz night is fun and the staff are really helpful and nice. Having said that, the food is really not that good. We tried the chicken wings and curry fries and both items I wish I hadn't eaten.
author: Anna J.

description:
This place used to be a staple on my weekend/evening to do list.  I still love the place - like the chill, lounge style atmosphere, as well as the pub fare.  All good!  Even the prices are decent.

Only giving it 4 (not 5) stars because sometimes the bartender (the lady) can be a real jerk.  Kinda snobby and annoying.  Other than that, this place is great!
author: Ryan D.

description: A good neighborhood bar with plenty of beers on tap, tv to watch, and some food to order if your hungry. They have about 10 beers on tap, which is great for someone who prefers their beer that way and it gives you plenty of selection from Anchor Steam Liberty to Guinness. The food is typical bar food of burgers, fries, chicken fingers, and fish and chips. The Tipsy Pig is a great place to stop for a beer and fries.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Sunday night pub quiz is terrific end-of-weekend activity.  It's relaxing and slow-paced; you have plenty of time to socialize.  Good selection of beers (though I wish they had Smithwicks).  

Peter's the best question-reader, as he's got panache, deadpan sarcasm, and true enthusiasm for the game.  Gotta love his music choices for the music round.

Winning team banks $30, while 2nd place and best small team (4 or fewer) get free drink coupons (pig bucks!).

Steve's at the bar on Sundays, and remembers your name after just a few visits.  

Tip the wait staff well, and they just might sneak you an answer :)

Yay: Curry fries (gross but delicious)

Boo: People cheating at trivia on their mobile devices.
author: Kevin L.

description: My new after class spot to get a drink. Sorry but it definitely beats the buckshot. Food isn't quite as good but wine list is much better (and there actually is a wine list). We also stumbled upon trivia night which was pretty fun.
author: Alex H.

description:
I'm giving this place a full 5 stars, as it is the closest place to my house, and gotta support the local bar! That, and it does have Newcastle, my favorite on tap (a deciding factor on me rating a place). In addition to that the food is OK, the burgers are good...for sports events they have a big projector screen that is pretty nice. In back they also have room for pool and darts (real darts even!). Get's a bit crowded on the weekend for how small of a place it is, but overall, I love it! The owner (Steve?) is a very nice guy. Happy this is my local place!

Update: Trivia night is also good fun...and Newcastle is on special!
author: Matthew S.

description: The P&W offers a college-bar like atmosphere and is a great place to kick back and relax while you're enjoying a good brew. The crowd here is lively and the staff is pretty good too. The prices are great: 3 orders of fish and chips, 1 order of shepard's pie, and 2 pitchers of beer was around $60.
author: Justen P.

description:
Another of my favorite bars from my USF days that I still make an effort to frequent....every Wednesday for trivia night.

Their trivia night (it happens Sunday now as well apparently) is always crowded, so try to get there early if you want a place to sit (starts at 8:30), and the drink special can't be beat: New Castle or 1664 $2.50 a pint.

Its also a genuinely nice place for happy hour or to watch a game.  Great pub grub, excellent juke box, pool table and darts, and friendly bartenders (i'm partial to Jenny myself).

Sure the bathroom smells, and if its crowded and chilly out it tends to get a little too humid.  But cool your concerns with a pint, you won't be disappointed.
author: Vince T.

description: I was here on a weekday, late afternoon.  Was getting new tires on my car down the street, so found this place (using yelp, of course) and decided to hang out while I waited.  Had some fish n' chips, which I devoured, and a pint of something yummy I can't remember.  Was just what I was looking for that day, but would definitely recommend you check it out.  Prompt, friendly service.  Chill atmosphere.  Good pub food.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Happy Hour! $3.50 Bottingtons $2.75 other beers.

Holy, this place serves REAL food. Mashed potatoes and meat! Fish and Chips! Great place for a late night meal!

Soccer on the tube all the time. Free pool on Sundays from noon until 8pm. Darts too!
author: Judy L.

description:
Awesome.

1. Fish n chips.  I can smell them from my door, and they beckon me!

2. It is approximately 500 feet from my door. 

3. Beer! I love beer.  They have lots of beer.  At reasonable prices!

4. Cute Irish guys.

5. Met some neighbors here!  After an incredibly bad date that they saw disintegrate, they bought me beer.  How awesome is that?!

I love my neighborhood!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I have been going to the Pig & Whistle to see my friend play pool for a tournament.  I can't believe I've lived in the area so long and never been.  It's quite a cute little pub, with good beer and good snack foods (beer batter mushrooms and stuff jalapenos were delish...the fish and chips looked good too) at a reasonable price.

It's a good place for chillin' with a small group of friends (5-6 people at most), but not really for anything larger than that.
author: Fontane L.

description:
That'll do Pig, that'll do...

In short, I consider Pig & Whistle as my "community bar".  The place I go for a nice prefade, or for a good happy hour, even as a fun spot on a weekday night (esp. on Wed, quiz night is always a riot, despite the difficult in answering some of the trivia after consuming a few pints).   

The crowd is predominantly college students with a few younger working class patrons like myself.  Always a friendly environment, with the regulars to the bartenders to even the barbacks providing very humorous and interesting conversations and quipps to keep you smiling and laughing for however long you decide to mingle at this bar.  

Also a decent sized crowd, seems like there are enough tables and chairs to go around for everyone and you usually don't have to worry about feeling like cattle squished into a single room, fighting for your life just to order a drink.  

Don't feel like just drinking and yapping away?  Pool table, darts, and pinball machines are also located towards the rear of the bar, satisfying those that are more geared for an "active" stay at the Pig. 

So overall, while it may not be the grandest of places, I feel like it has more than enough for me to call it "my pub".
author: Reuben M.

description: Awesome place for beer and pub grub.  i love it there.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I love the Pig & Whistle. They have a great selection of beers. I love my Guinness, but I try to try a new beer everytime I go. The bartenders are great and even though I don't come in too often they always remember what I had. My boyfriend and I have had conversations with more than 1 drunk English or Irish guy, but I'm such a sucker for an accent that I will listen to their stories all night.

The fish & chips and the fried mushrooms are awesome and the portions are huge.

I'm older than college age, so I try not to come when the place will be loaded with drunk college kids.

Parking's not bad. Even if I come in the evenings I can find parking within a block of the place.
author: Maria M.

description:
This place is a real pub. I spent a summer in london, and my roomate spent a summer in Ireland and we both agree this is a fantastic Pub. They have darts,
they have pool, 
lots of good beer on tap, 
and the bartenders have accents.
Bangin'.

Oh and their shepherds pie is really goddamn delicious. 

Just go. I hear the trivia night on wednesdays are fun, I haven't been but want to check it out tonight.
author: Jake R.

description:
RELIABLE.  TASTY.  EXCELLENT VALUE.  NICE STAFF.

The Pig & Whistle is such a local institution, it's tempting to not sing its praises just 'cause you don't want to sound, well... unoriginal.  Piffle.  I just spent a wad on a near by restaurant and wished I'd saved my dollars and come to the Piggy for a nice burger.  

My friends in London and I used to have a "VFM" standard.  Value For Money.  Places swank and trashy were equally reviewed based on relative bang for buck - as opposed to overall bucks, or bang without reference to aforementioned buck.

Piggy is a VFM superstar.  It's hellaciously reliable.  It's always friendly, even when busy.  NEVER any attitude behind that bar, darn it.  No matter how busy.  The crowd is on the mellow side - young and old both, with a slightly older crowd than I'm used to seeing on Friday evenings for example.

A medium rare burger comes... medium rare or medium.  Not well.  This, in itself, for a large, well prepared pub burger is unusual.  Beer is fairly priced.  I've always found the place pretty clean.  The toilet is usually at least in ok shape - you won't get kooties or lose your appetite if you need to use it. :)

I love reliability.  I love quality.  I love VFM.  Piggy has been good to me.
author: Juliana C.

description: The food is reasonably authentic. There are still a few things that have a bit of an American twang on them, but overall it fits the bill. The food is also rather cheep, as is pub food back in the UK. There's a decent beer selection. A few more British beers on tap would be nice, but they got enough to fit the bill. It also has that low key atmosphere in which you can actually talk to people, as one would find in a pub in the UK. I would recommend this place to drink or eat.
author: Joe D.

description: A bar that was established for the locals, TP&W is a place to watch a game and chat with patrons over a beer (the chill version). This is not a place to get amped and rowdy in your jersey that is soaked with beer. People come in in t-shirts, shorts and sandals straight out of their living rooms for a Guiness. They also serve Irish bar food with a limited selection. I thought the food was decent, recognizing it was not their forte.  Neighborhood bars like this one are always a friendly place to go.
author: Ed L.

description:
First, FYI this is an English Pub-- the owners are English, the pub is English-- they tend to focus on Arsenal and other English sports teams for a reason-- nothing wrong with Irish Pubs, this is just not one of them.

Second, they have the best bar staff of any SF pub-- best by far, there were some freakishly funny bartenders on Clement St. circa 2002 that didn't id us when we were underage, but that couple included-- this is the best pub staff in town.  If this was a review of Jenny et al (Jenny the bartender is the star of this show) this review would be 5 stars-- no question. 

Their quiz night-- best in town, great mix of people (when the USF crowd isn't too intense-- I am an ulum, but I would prefer not to hang out with the class of 2011 each week) the quiz is also reasonably easy  for groups of drunk friends, well at least I think so, we went alot in college, and my friends and I still win whenever we make an appearance.

Beer selection: could use improvement: they have Smithwicks, and Sierra, besides that I tend to share a lot  of pitchers of "compromise beer" here, and there is nothing on tap that is all that exciting

Seating: their seats remind me of real London pubs: which is an element of the London pub I would not mind forgetting-- Benches against a wall, and those captain seats that make your coat fall on the ground.

Scene: I have been here for a beer on Saturday: live music night, and left immediately-- if you are an English man in your 50's who thinks that the world ended when Springsteen stopped playing in small clubs run here-- if not try it for a chill beer and burger some other night.

Food: good pub food, and I have two friends really into the deserts.
author: Megan O.

description:
Super chill bar. Perfect for a nice afternoon with a book or a newspaper. They have Soccer and most major sports on TV. The beer selection is great. The food is typical pub food, but with flavor. I had the Chicken Breast and veggies and was impressed. I like how the bar and pool room are separate, it allows space. 

The bartender was cool. He was very relaxed and low key. Overall this is a nice friendly neighborhood bar that allows you to enjoy your beer in a cool environment.
author: Eric B.

description:
My teeth are going crooked, there's a wee bit of a hair growing betwixt my eyebrows, and a got a banging faux Brit accent...yup! My foodie gang hit upon the British coast of pub grub.

Everyone except Andrea and me got the fish and chips. I ventured forth and grabbed a shepherd's pie (anything topped with luscious mash potatoes is always a goodie). The ground beef were moist and juicy with lots of peas and onions to flavor it out. The dish came with yummy veggies, then  I ordered fish chowder for the first time....ummm...it was really fishy, but watery. I'm used to chowder being thick and creamy...sigh....but the soft giant pieces of bread were carb heaven.

As a pub virgin, I've never heard of malt vinegar...the flavor and the watering of my eyes pretty much told me that I wasn't pouring that over my sample of fish and chips...hehe...Everyone's fish fry was tongue-burning hot. And the fries were thick cut and crispy. I really liked the calamari...wow...it was nice big pieces.

The pub has nice wooden tables for groups, a dart board area for times where you wanna stab needles into something, and the back area had pool tables.  One thing everyone should never do, is grab your hands on the tables edges...I had what must have been a decades worth of goop under those tables smeared on my fingers. 

The food is very reasonable, not expensive, and if they'd despackle the grime under the table...not a bad place to hang out in.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Great chill pub to hang with friends if you're in close proximity to the Inner Richmond. In addition to having good beers on tap and greasy bar food (lots and lots of different fried options), it's got a huge pool hall attached. Who knew?! A huge pool hall in the middle of the space-constrained city! 

The vibe morphed throughout the night. Right before I got there, evidently it was packed with a guys softball team post-game. Then two little kids started sprinting across the pub back and forth to the dart board. Throughout, a steady sprinkling of locals held down the bar stools. 

And the bartender was good... when we ordered a new beer they'd just replaced the keg and she gave us a sample to make sure it'd settled right. It hadn't, and no questions asked she poured us something else. Lots of places just would have served it and hoped we didn't notice.
author: Shoshana D.

description:
Years ago my old roommate, who used to torment me no end, would ask me to take her to Pwistle.  Pigwitsel?  Something like that.  It was hard to know because beyond a her thick accent and lack of interest in my understanding her, she had puffy cheeks and talked a like Marlon Brando in the Godfather.  Eventually we agreed that this sound meant Pig and Whistle, the mellow Irish bar where she would pool shark and criticize me on various matters.  

We came early one week and she announced she wanted me to buy dinner.  Where, I asked.  You decide.  Can't you do anything, she added under her breath.  I pointed to Kan Thok.  Want to go there?  That's so lame, she mumbled.  Idiot.  Here?  I pointed to Ton Kiang.  Oh, alright.  I knew you would say that, she said.  Why?  White guys, they always want to go to there. 

Later, she beat me at pool and told me I had to kiss her dog Lulu, who was snarling at me
author: Gil S.

description:
So much fun! Nice cozy space and fantastic bartenders. God everyone was so nice. We went for trivia night and ended up winning two drinks! Yay best small team score! That's right, I said it. beginner's luck I guess.

Food... calamari and corn chowder. Nice home style grubbings.

Thanks for the great recommendation for a sunday night pub!
author: Annie T.

description: I like it here because it brings back nostalgic memories of when I was a wee child and used to work with my gramps in the City going to all his clients emptying and servicing the machines. He was a video game vendor, and owned the pool table and pinball machines in this place.  I recently went back to check it out and it hadn't changed much over the years. They didn't have the Terminator pinball machine anymore, but still offered just quality pub grub and bar games in a relaxed working-class environment.
author: Rick H.

description:
Please note this review is only for their Trivia Night. I used to frequent Beckett's Trivia Night back when I lived in Berkeley and this place is terrible in comparison. 

The bartender was rude. And the trivia guy? A complete a-hole. 

The crowd was cool and  having a good time, but we left after a beer or two, because it got too hot and we got tired of being ignored by everyone that worked there.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Good beer, strong drinks, darts, a pool table, soccer and sports on the TVs.

I'm sure there's other stuff going on as well. Food, I know, and people and stuff. But really, beer.

It's a proper place, chill and relaxed, fun without being too much, unpretentious.

I've heard their food is good but I always seem to roll in full from Assab down the street (try it) or after the kitchen's closing (which is late, but not too late to drink delicious beer).

Give it a try if you're in the neighborhood. It's good people.
author: Daniel G.

description:
I have to give the PIg 5 stars because I've spent more time there than at my house, and if it wasn't 5 stars good then what the hell was I doing there for that long?  
Why you go to the Pig...to get hammered, to watch the game, to not have to change out of your sweats before you drink, or to pick up your car the next day and grab breakfast, still in the same sweats.   And because the owner Steve is hugely accommodating and a nice guy,  and the bartenders are great, as long as you don't ask for a blender drink or something with ingredients you shouldn't ask for in a pub.   One reason you won't go to the Pig is to get laid, as the place just isn't like that, and as long as you know and accept that then bottoms up. So to speak. 

I love the English breakfast--bacon, ham, beans, eggs, potatoes, and toast-to the point of craving it sometimes.  Not sure why.  The other food is very decent, and the drinks are cheap enough.  I like the free pool on Sundays, in theory, but I've only taken advantage once.  I like the happy hour every day.  Go to the Pig, it is better than (my) home.  And their co-ed softball team rocks, and has jaeger drinking  women who are your ONLY chance to get some ass while you sit in your three day old sweats.
author: Kean S.

description:
Those no good rotten bikers that are seemingly always here?  Yeah, that's us.  This has been our regular Wednesday meeting spot for a long time now; the P&W treats us so well.  They know our names, give us free stuff occasionally and reserve tables for us on a regular basis.  Great people, great, delicious, hearty food!

My only complaint is that the temperature sucks.  It gets hot and muggy inside, but the outside is like a wind tunnel.  Brrr!
author: Frankie D.

description:
The Pig & Whistle is probably the best English-style pub in San Francisco.  The space is nice and open, with good wooden tables and chairs for groups and a nice bar.  It's a bit of a neighborhood place, but it's also a destination for a lot of people.

Top things: hand pulled pints of London's Pride, decent pub food (sometimes more decent than others), and the fact that you can take kids there in the daytime for food and hang out (this was a very pleasant surprise).

The pool table is small and a bit shabby, but not the worst.  Only 50 cents, which is unheard of in this day and age in SF.

And, I have to say it, the most beautiful bartender in town, the incredibly lovely Jeni, who seems to have quite a following.
author: Kennelco C.

description:
USF watering hole. Got me through undergrad. Don't remember what it looked like back then other than wall-to-wall youngsters. Just remember my first red wine experience at a venue was from here *sigh*. Don't miss it on your St. Paddy's Day Pub Crawl.

Boddington's on tap is a beautiful thing.
author: Tanya P.

description:
Great to be able to get "Bangers and Mash" here; I love the fact that they have the same baked beans that they have back home in Ireland.
The mash potatoes were a little soggy but all in all this was a surprisingly good bar; I sad I never went here when I lived relatively close by for four years.
Pint of Guinness was pretty good also :)
author: Bryan B.

description:
The Pig and Whistle is located quite close to my house and I've come to appreciate it in the last six months.  On many nights this bar makes my block pretty roudy and inebriated USF students stumble around and us sober folks sometimes get irritated by this, not the stumbling and inebriation so much as the shouting that results from it.  But this isn't  why I appreciate the bar.
