Since I've become legal, I've actually found this place soothing.  When it's not a source of disturbance, it's a nice quiet pub with a friendly staff and regulars, who are not college students.  They have the usual bar food: poppers, fries, etc, as well as substantial items like steak.  Sometimes my mom and I feel lazy and just want a low key dinner and cosmo.  This is not a place I can recommend for great steak, but for a bar especially, it's more than decent.  

On big game days it's filled with men screaming.  On weekends it's filled with young people screaming. All other times it's mellow.  They have a pool table in the back and some day during the week is a trivia/game day, I havne't attended, but have heard about it.

It's the proximity primarily that brings me back, I wouldn't travel across town to come here though.  It's a pub and there are tons all over SF of equal quality I'm sure.  Still, for what it is, it's good!
author: Aristocles P.

description:
Back in ancient times, I went on a trip all over Spain, and let me tell you there was some stank happening up in there. But by the end of our trip, my friends and I could have cared less. "Meh, it stinks in Spain," we said, and continued on, splashing through fetid puddles in our rush to the discoteca. And 50 cent Spanish beer. 

This lovely fable from days of yore brings me to my point: Our great city can be a bit malodorous, but we must soldier on! Complaining about stinkiness on Yelp? Not necessary and BORING! Who wants to read those reveiws? Not me!

However.

The Pig & Whistle. Smells. Like. Very. Bad. Body. Odor.

But! Perhaps they can solve this problem by opening a window! And I am pretty sure the body odor came from the genuine drunken Irish people that were propped up on the bar... 

Other than that, there wasn't really anything noteworthy... I came here for a birthday of someone that lived nearby, I probably wouldn't come back unless I lived in the neighborhood. Meh.
author: Katie H.

description:
Tried their fish and chips (~$10) and few beers ($3 per pint, except Guinness $3.5) during happy hour. 

The fish and chips was so bland that I added plenty of salt and pepper just to finish one piece of fish. The other piece was untouched. The chips/fries were even worse; I only ate one piece. SAVE YOUR $10 and SKIP THIS GARBAGE.

P&W has a good beer selection. That is the only thing positive about this place. I would only go back on Sunday for the free pool.
author: Ed W.

description:
The best trivia bar in the city!
The trivia fits a perfect balance of not being ridiculously hard while still not being easy.  Ray is a great emcee and unlike in other trivia bars in the city he does not get on your nerves by the end of the night.  
The pub food here is just that - good solid pub food.
Most importantly Pig & Whistle has a variety of good beer on tap at reasonable prices (especially the specials.)

P.S. all the statements about the large quantities of USF students are true, however it has never ruined my enjoyment of the bar.
author: Greg J.

description:
Plan and simple just a cool bar.

Added bonus that it's near B-school.

Food is not bad either...
author: Francis M.

description: Don't get the calamari rings, everyone at your table will ask to try your "onion rings" and get a disturbing look on their face when you inform them it's calamari. The heavy batter overwhelms the taste of the squid.
author: Dan X.

description:
The Pig and Whistle is a place that I have wasted time, talent and brain cells many, many times.

I love it.

The bartenders are great, and a $2.50 pint of Newcastle just can't be beat.  Add in real fish and chips (a whole filet - with malt vinegar, and HP sauce for the chips) and you've got the perfect place to drink away a weekday.

Trivia nights on Wednesday are also great.  Nothing boosts flagging self-esteem more surely or less justly like being the one to remember that the B-52s sang "Roam."*

(Unfortunately, I did not remember that - and my team lost.  Sorry guys)
author: Adam B.

description: I have never written a Yelp review, but I am so appalled by the unnecessary disrespect of a bartender there at the end of the night tonight that I (and my four friends) will never go there again. We were having an absolute wonderful time for the few hours that we were there but when they were closing, three of us were waiting for our two friends to close out their tab just before 2 am and during this time this blacked out female (skeletor looking) bartender was yelling at us with comments including "I'm not kidding, drink the f**k up" and as she was stepping on the wooden bench near the window to close the curtains, she stepped directly next to where i was sitting (on less than 1 square foot of area) and said "you're in my way!" The bar was NOT busy while we were there so I said "we spent $100 here and you're making me never want to come here again" and her response was "i don't give a f**k." i responded with " we bought six pitchers" (which is actually closer to $120 without tip) and she said "no you didn't" and at that time i knew i was sober compared to her incoherent state. She also claimed that it was 2:10 am at the time that she was yelling at us but by the time we got in a cab after this confrontation it was 2:02 am. The unfortunate part is that we WERE having a great time, but her demeanor at the end of the night completely ruined it. I've never seen someone be so unprofessional and so willing to lose business, which was so unbelievably unnecessary and avoidable.
author: Kim N.

description:
A good English pub.  The Pig and Whistle has become a social staple for me and my Limey boyfriend, who occasionally suffers from bouts of homesickness for which a pint of London Pride and the occasional football match(that's soccer fur us 'mericans) on their big screen provide temporary salve. 

The shepherd's pie is tasty and provides an excellent base for an evening's alcohol.  Friendly bar staff too.
author: Monkeyfaced E.

description:
Another establishment i frequented with friends during my short stay in SF.  the bar had a good atmosphere the time i was there. Had an area with a bar, tables to eat at, shoot some pool, and some other activity i can't recall. 

We went there mainly because it was walking distance from anza street where our apartments were so that was a big plus. when i say that, of course im referring to the walk back to our apartments late at night all blacked out!!! it would always be a fun walk back and best of all, we didn't have to pay any cab fare. 

One bad note about this place is that when it's crowded, it can get suffocating and hot real fast so be sure to order a cool, tall glass of whatever it is that you drink because you'll be thankful for it...
author: Tony V.

description: This place is a find.  The fish and chips are the best I've ever had and talk about reasonably priced.  The beer selection is excellent.  I'm mad about the Fuller's on tap.  The interior is just what one would expect of a pub and the parking in the area is pretty decent.  The young gentleman witht he mustache who works there has treated me kindly ever since I've been going there and considering all the rude bartenders in this town that's a jewel in the crown all of its own.  This place is fabulous!
author: Sin F.

description: As far as bar food, this is pretty darn good. One of the top onion ring joints ever. That and their beer list is thru the roof. I don't even drink and damn that's a lot of beer. I could drink one of those airplane size bottles and be done. STEEEELLLLAAA!
author: Jon H.

description:
The bar caught my eye off to the side and I made a mental note to head back after hitting the Irish bakery. I had a blast. 

The crowd is super nice and by the end a nice lady had given me a back massage and I was being treated like a regular. 

The best thing about this place....the Irish men, blue eyed, dark haired, accented Irish men. At one point I was seriously worried that I was going to leave the bar with an assault charge or impregnated. Irish men are just my fav, I can't help it! If I can bribe my way into heaven I am going to make sure it is stocked with Blue Eyed, dark haired, accented Irish men. Yummy. 

Drinks were decently priced, but I was there for happy hour. Food looked good and I am kind of wishing I lived in the city instead of Castro Valley. Me so hungry. 

I had 2 jager shots
2 Irish coffees
cider
and something else I think, 20.50. 

The Irish guys told me that it was technically an English Pub, but it was still okay. hehe.
author: Jocelyn F.

description:
Tyler W. says it all.  The P&W, with its solid beer selection, great service, tasty food, and friendly patrons, can distract even a sober you (I've heard) from company you've inherited but may or may not want mentioned in your biography.

Hopefully my grandkids will be able to find my name in the index of "Unchained Will: The Story of Tyler Willis".
author: George M.

description: This is a great little place. They even let my friend dance on the table. They have some great bands play here occassionally (I say that because they have a friends band play occassionally). If I lived closer, I would come more often. But I don't. Which is sad, now that I think about it. I should move closer. I really should. I hear they have trivia, which I would love to go to if I lived closer....
author: Danielle L.

description: The staff was super friendly and the ambiance was excellent. The food was great and maybe slightly unauthentic but that never stops me from liking it if it is delicious. The prices were pretty good. I guess the only reason I am only giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is because it was a little more expensive than it could have been... but it wasn't bad at all 4 dollars for a pint.
author: Stephen S.

description:
My family and I dined at the pig and whistle last night.  Although the place was quite noisy, the food was great.  You go to the bar to order, and after just a short wait, we were served.  The fish and chips were outstanding.  The chips, or French fries to us in the USA , were Fresh, not frozen.
The burgers and shepherds pie were also good.  The beer was top notch as well.  The bill for 4 was less than $50.  You can not do that very often in SF.
author: Chad M.

description:
For lunch, there is ample parking all around Geary -- which is key.

This is what I thought Liverpool Lil's would be like -- an authentic British pub.

Their shepherd's pie is fantastic.  In the bay area, perhaps only the Mayflower approaches the quality.  A bunch of co-workers got the fish and chips -- they raved about the fish, but felt the fries were a little weak.

I'll be heading here regularly for lunch.  If you see me, I'm the guy drinking Bass in the corner not wearing the painter's frock or the caltrans uni.
author: Tim G.

description:
Staff: friendly and helpful. Beer: great tasting selection (newly discovered affinity for Boont, thanks to bartender's suggestion). 

The fries I ordered were bland and burnt, and had no seasoning whatsoever, so I can see what Jerry J. meant about the food in his review before mine. 

Patrons can be douchebags. Not all. People there are generally approachable, respect other people's space and strike up unpressured conversations like mature adults. However, the occasional P&W asshole has proven to be a big enough asshole to ruin your good mood for the rest of your stay.  And I'm talking about the old men - the young people I saw are quite well mannered in comparison, despite hearing it was the other way around in an earlier review. Unfortunately, it's mostly a middle-aged to ancient crowd that fills the place. And not enough cute British accents to make up for it.
author: Clar L.

description: It's a bar. With beer. And bar food. If you like these things, you will like this place. End of story.
author: Dana S.

description: Great beer selection on tap.  My fav would probably be Speckled Hen.  Food would probably be of the 3 star variety but you don't come here for the food.  Not a bad place to grab a beer on a Friday after a grueling work week.
author: Brian A.

description:
Gotta love a place that gives me (what looked like) 20 jalapeño poppers when I was expecting the standard 8. 

I ordered a Lemon-drop, like always, and ended up getting my drink plus the "extra" of what she made. Turned out to be two full drinks for the price of one. Excellent! 

I went on a Monday, and it was dead. Perfect for our bday party. 

One of my greasier, 40-something coworkers started drooling when I told him of my destination for that evening. He says the "college crowd is amazing"... which gave me the creeps!  I'll take his word for it and only attend this on a Monday.
author: Towanda S.

description: Great neighborhood bar, for being a chill hang out spot when with a group (if you get a table) and for sports games! They have a projection screen they roll down sometimes for bigger games too. Quality, usual bar food and then some, and a good selection of beers :) i'm so glad there's a place like this in my neighborhood!
author: Lana L.

description:
Grungy yet safe, good food, nice bartenders, awesome location...

Great if you go to USF.
author: Gavin S.

description: Great Pub style food.  We played darts in the back and hung out, great afternoon atmosphere.
author: Matt S.

description: I have a friend that's a huge fan of this place so I finally checked it out last night.  Pig & Whistle is actually a really great pub.  I love the atmosphere and the food is fairly cheap and good.  Big portions as well.  We got the fried mushrooms which were greasy and yummy just the way I like them.  I also ordered the steak which was a good size and came with a side of veggies and a huge serving of mash and gravy!  They have a pool table (or tables, I didn't check it out) in the back and a dart board in the back of the front.  Nice chill atmosphere.  I had a great time here!
author: Elena N.

description:
My friends know I'm a bit of an Anglophile, so when I was in a bleary haze one morning-after, they knew where they could take me to feel better. After a full English and a few pints of Fuller's London Pride, I knew I'd been introduced to a gem.


 Sure, the atmosphere's a bit blah - not as cozy as a typical pub - but the Pig still oozes charm in the form of curt but friendly bar service (the bartender will mess with you when he sees you're bleary-eyed), excellent music, authentic pub food, and a proper selection of beers. If only they had cask ale and fried tomatoes to go with the breakfast - then they'd get that elusive fifth star.
author: Omid T.

description:
Pretty much a standard pub.  Pool table, darts, wooden seating. Came here after the Hawaiian place so the review maybe tempered by that experience.  All I know is that they have Boddingtons (yay!), that I could taste the vodka in my vod & DC (double yay!) and that they didn't actually kick us out until EXACTLY 2 am.  I've never actually experienced that.  And that rocks.  

However the smell in toilets made my friend almost want to throw up.  But I've definitely seen worse.
author: Alexis B.

description:
I used to go here like twice a week when I was at USF,
and not only because it was one of the nearest. 
Good atmosphere, funny folks.Billiards are good, darts are good, some pinball games are good, too.
For some reason, Stella here tastes a little better than the regular ones, too. Their sandwhiches or burgers are good, and love their potato salads on the side...

I like original folks here, but recenlty from time to time, they have some younger ones on the bar and they could be annoying. Maybe it's because I was not getting usual greetings and funny chats and the conversation started with "May I see your ID" which rarely happened when I knew the old folks.

And here is a 4-star... why? Because of TVs...
They actually have a large projector and screen for big sports games, too. However, they are rarely used and TVs are rather small and hard to watch when I am sitting in some positions, and they are not flat nice ones...

But I would still go here, and it is a regular reunion-ish place whenever I meet my USF folks, and it's always good...
author: Andrew Y.

description: Perfect local euro pub.  Great bar food, never extremely crowded, cool owner guy, great vibes!
author: Ryan H.

description:
I adore the Pig & Whistle! A great pub!

There's just something about it--it's definitely a no frills bar, but it certainly has a cheery atmosphere and warmth about it. 

An all around great atmosphere for relaxing, watching a game, or having something to eat. 

For being as close as it is to USF, I expected more college students. It seems more of a neighborhood bar than a place students go to drink.
author: Sophie D.

description: "The USF bar." The windows are always fogged up from body heat. It also smells like arm pits. It really knows how to put the sour in my whisky.
author: Alex H.

description:
The Pig & Whistle - there need be no other bar for me.

Last time I was there, the gruff, no-nonsense bar back fella (the one who brings the plates out from the kitchen) asked me how my fish & chips was. (He speaks!)

'It was great, thanks' I replied.

'Did you notice anything different about it?' he queried.

'Well...'

Then ensued a 10-minute discussion with him and the bartender about the origins of the fish and the latest particulars of provisioning same at a Bay Area pub-type establishment. Turns out everybody in town has been forced to change from snapper to cod (or something). Fascinating! Although honestly the fish tasted the same as always.

Ariel and I have wasted many an evening here eating fried food, swilling beer, hogging the jukebox and thinking up witty pub trivia team names.

Speaking of which, Wednesday quiz is a hoot with the always-wacky Ray Darbyshire. I just wish he would stop flirting with my wife.
author: Dave P.

description:
Very authentic pub. I really liked the feel of the place. Kinda small, but definitely a good vibe -- felt like a neighborhood bar back in Philly. Great beer selection and good prices. I didn't try the food but it looked good, especially the fish and chips, which was a huge portion.

I went on a Wednesday night and played trivia with friends. Interesting questions, great turnout and a lot of fun.
author: Courtney D.

description:
I have to love a place which allows us in the Bay Area Riders Forum to hold weekly socials in their bar during the winter months. And for not batting an eye when I show up in moto gear on my top half, kilt on the bottom half.
What makes the P&W great isn't any one piece - the food is good, the help has personality and is fun to chat with, they have great drinks on tap as well as mixed, there's usually a good mix of people present. Put it all together and it's great deal of fun.
Throw in Wednesday trivia night - and it will be a weekly routine with your friends!
author: J. K.

description:
Good solid spot.  I haven't eaten here, but prices seem really reasonable.  

Staff are ok - except they tend to ignore customers standing at bar for service.  And they are not that busy.  hmmm.  But overall, I like it.
author: J M.

description:
Awesome beer selection
food is great! (try the shepard's pie)
Rad bartenders
darts
pool
quiz night (wed)

My favorite pub in the city!!!
author: Scott B.

description:
This place is a great place to bring your friends, get hammskeed and play trivia. 

During my college years alot of buds would cruise in and just set up the utimate team. I think we always got second to last or third to last place in trivia. Good times. 

Its a great place to go with a group especially during the week. If you are hungry they do serve food wich is pretty decent. They have a chicken breast dinner with veggies that would make your mama proud.

The potty is clean
author: Ash D.

description: A classic British pub in the heart of the City. This is our after-work decompression destination. Chris is always the cordial bartender and pours a proper Black & Tan. I'm a big fan of the Fuller's London Pride and Old Speckled Hen. Also, any pub that has Highland Park on the shelf is OK by me. The kitchen is great with some of the best fish & chips in the city. Don't miss the curry chips. Nice dart board as well. (Note: I do miss the pool table.)
author: Michael j g.

description:
This has been my local watering hole for the past 5+ years.  Wednesday Trivia Nights are a blast, as well as most weeknights.  It's an awesome place to go to if you just want to chill with friends, maybe throw some darts, or just watch a sporting event.
I wish that Andy was still bartending here, but Jen is still there, and she is super, duper cool... she makes the funnest and yummiest shots ever!
Food here is great, the best Fish & Chips in town.  They also make a mean tomato and rice soup, oh, and don't get me started on their chicken wings, YUM!
I wish that their bathrooms were cleaner, but hey, you can't have everything...
author: Mariana A.

description: I have to admit, I'm a weekly visitor to this place. Great little neighborhood English Pub...and fun Pub Quiz! I go on Wednesday night but they also have it on Sunday (but I think with a different "quiz master"). Ray, the "quiz master" on Wednesday is totally awesome. Also, drinks are generally pretty cheap (4-5 bucks mostly for a pint) and they have a pretty good selection on-tap including Boddington's and Speckled Hen. During pub quiz Newcastle pints are only $2.50! Generally it's pretty crowded (even on non-pub quiz nights) and you can count on being able to watch most major sporting events there. The staff is fantastic and if you're looking for some English Pub fare - the food is worth a shot too! Oh, and also, their juke box has possibly the best music ever!
author: Amber P.

description: Excellent fish n chips.  Great beers on tap.  Fun, mellow crowd: nurses, off work fellows, and random "older" Irish guys.  Just a great local bar.
author: Jennifer T.

description: After a stressful half day at work, I desperately needed a beer. Pig and Whistle came to the rescue. Spacious interior with great pig decorations everywhere put a smile to my face. The bartender and patron were nice and friendly. The food was remarkably better than expected and came in huge portions! It's a great place to come and wind down after work, shoot some pool or play trivia. I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Tina Y.

description: Trendy bar it ain't but if your looking for a friendly neighborhood bar this it. Good food at reasonable prices, friendly staff and stiff drinks make the pig a winner. They have several TVs and have a projector they set up for big sporting events. Wednesday and Sunday are trivia nights.
author: Michael R.

description: MMMM...Shepherds Pie and a pint of Stella...yumm
author: Starla D.

description:
yesterday, i started my evening at bourbon and branch.  i paid $70 for 4 drinks.  

i didn't blink.

i ended my evening at pig and whistle.  i paid $18 for 4 drinks.

i stared at the bartender in disbelief.  honestly, i was floored.

b&b: $70
p&w: $18

how did i EVER get to this point where i dont even think twice about blowing so much money on drinks (albeit quality well made cocktails)?

who am i??  

thank you, p&w, for bringing me back down from yuppiedom to my humble roots.
author: Helen L.

description: There is one British club I belong to and it's Pig and Whistle and they accept women. Beer on draft, buffalo chicken wings, all for less then $10, loud men watching sports come in the package, but that's what you get when you join men's club.
author: Tatiana G.

description: The best Fish and Chips I ever had believe it or not was at the IVY in Beverly Hills--I dont know why in fuck they made it but they did and it was amazing. BUT, a close second would have to be Pig & Whistle's Fish and CHips no diggity ,no doubt. Great atmosphere. Amazing jukebox(THEY HAD JOY DIVISION WTF!!!).  My best friend Gabe had a shephards pie that could bring down an international superpower. Their wine sucks there though, but who goes to pubs to drink wine...oh ya snobs like me.
author: Lauren V.

description: Pub grub and a Guiness before a movie at the Bridge theatre....blimey...only wankers go to kates in soma...(Pigs know where to catch better grub, better service, whistlin after cuter guys...Pig out THEN Whistle oer dat Bridge-ey)
author: miriam b.

description:
i came here for dinner last night with some good friends, and it was absolutely perfect.  the decor was right out of many an english pub i'd ventured into in london, but it was pleasantly quiet on that random tuesday evening.  service was excellent (you have to go up to the bar to order your food), and the bartender was this kind but gruff irishman.

the food was *excellent*.  for an appetizer, we had the curry fries (which i've never had before, anywhere) and they were simply scrumptious.  my fish and chips were battered to perfection.  crunchy and buttery, but not so greasy that i felt ill (frequently a problem with fried food).  my friends ordered the shepherd's pie and the chicken curry masala, and both enjoyed their meals thoroughly.

in fact, my only problem with this place was the slightly frenetic music selection.  hip-hop, george michael, rap????  no no no....i'm still giving it 5 stars though for the ambience and the food, since that's all i went there for!
author: Roshni R.

description: So, ive only been here drinking and its a bit like walking into a boozer in the UK .... you get the pissed irish man attempting to introduce himself and lots of cute british guys getting pissed at the bar .. perfect for when feeling homesick me thinks ... i hear they have a cricket team and football team .. i must check that out ! ;o)
author: Amy W.

description: I came here with a friend because it's a great pub within walking distance of my house.  The food was reasonably priced and the curry fries came with the mango chutney at our request, very yummy.  It's so British I was surprised no one busted out a drinking song while I was there, but hey, it was only a Monday and the Trader Joe's after work crowd had taken over much of the bar.
author: Cara J.

description: Its name is derived from the Old English words 'Piggin,' a large lead cup used to serve spiced wine, and 'Wassail,' the wine itself, and it's as authentic a British pub as you can find outside Henley-on-Thames or some such similar riverside town in the UK. The food is the real deal - Cornish Pasty, Sausage Rolls, Bangers and Mash, Steak and Mushroom or Shepherds Pie, and outstanding Fish and Chips, two lightly battered filets of Icelandic cod served with wedge cut fries and a salad. Breakfast, served until 3:00pm, is exactly what my London friend Gerald has served on many a Sunday morning - scrambled eggs, bangers, Irish bacon, black pudding, baked beans, home fries, and toast, a meal that generally sticks to my ribs until Monday afternoon. The bartenders have been taught the fine art of pouring a Guinness - fill a 20-ounce glass two-thirds, allow the stout to sit, then top it with a white creamy head that floats just above the rim. British ales on tap include Bass, Boddingtons, and Newcastle Brown, and they also stock Blackthorn Premium Cider. There's pool, pinball, and darts for recreation, and it's easy to find willing competitors among the very sociable crowd. Calling all Anglophiles!
author: Gourmet G.

description: Trivia night every Wednesday has become a key facet of my social calendar. When else will you be considered brilliant because you know the name of Eddie Murphy's alter ego in the Nutty Professor? (Its Buddy Love btw). Great fish and chips, and when they have it, fried chicken.
author: Noelle Q.

description: In need to get your drink on? Don't want the hassle and crowds of clubs? Hate the pretentiousness of lounges and wine bars? This is your place. Its about as family a bar you can get, that is if your family consists of beer Ydrinkers. Like any pub the main focus here is beer. I've personally never had a mixed drink here but they do make them, just dont order no cosmo.  There's about 20 beers on tap with a good selection of domestic micro-brews and imports. Food ain't bad either, where else are u gonna find "Bangers and Mash".  That and I've never had a bad time here... knock on wood.
author: Chris F.

description: Came here with a friend for some pub grub, and it was grubbin'!  The shepherd's pie and the burger were extremely filling.  We also had the calamari, which was weird because it was in the shape of an onion ring.  So everytime you took a bite, you thought you were eating a rubbery onion ring.  Atmosphere is great, good music and sports on TV, and the service was fantastic.  I think everyone in the bar (bartender excluded) was drunk...and it was only 7pm on a Monday night!
author: Mark D.

description: On 8-1-09,after having dinner at hukilau, my friend,her daughter, and I walked about a block over/went inside this bar to see a band play music(initially was good,but after it sucked). We ordered anchor steam beer on tap.  I  noticed a particular scent in the bar and keep smelling fish.  Several older individuals there and eventually I got bored and left.
author: Jer W.

description:
This place is literally 700 feet from my house, needless to say I frequent it.  Now I essentially live @ work and school, so i don't come as often as I'd like, and I don't have as good a grasp on this bar as say the Dogpatch or Mission Bars. But let me tell you about this little gem.
 
Great food (fish and chips can be a bit bland but shepherds pie = god)
Ample free pool & less ample free darts (save your quarters for laundry!)
Pitchers of plentiful beer selection.
Neat mixed crowd, lots of folk. Make no mistake, this is a scots bar!

So as you can see, this is a great freaking bar. Now let me regale you with why I decided to yelp it now, after attending quite a few times.  With Bars I like to have a real story before I yelp them, unless they really stand out or I might be the first to yelp em.  Often also I go home and drunk yelp the place only to find that i never actually submitted my review and just forgot about it entirely. This was not the case with PNW, this was...

So I had just gotten off a long shoot (where we totally nailed the product shot, only to see that the Heineken bottle was out of focus, so much for an A on that film project). Rode the bus home, showered, and ba-dum-sum-cha my buddy Dave is at my door with a 12-pack of Newcastle.  We crack em open, let the dogs run out back and start talking about school.  Shortly after my friend (and now yelp friend) George M. shows up as well.  A few more beers later we mosey to the Pig and Whistle to meet an actor from our school + girlfriend, Dave's girlfriend Jill and her two co-workers, Later to be met by friend Kent. This is where the night turned bad.  Now Dave is as solid as a brick wall, but he acts crazy. Most people would think him pulling his knife on me three times was why it went bad, you'd be wrong (and if you thought that, you wouldn't be friends with Dave). Now Jill is always a hoot-n-a-half so no problems there. Kent is an awesome guy and George has quite a few markings of "coolest mother on the planet." So we've eliminated them, which leaves us with, Jill's co-workers.  OK, they were really nice for awhile - kinda dull, but that's more than ignorable with pitcher after pitcher of beer and a group of 9 people. But it all goes downhill when you start proclaiming that this is such a nice Irish bar. It's Scottish, I don't expect you to know that, but I'm Irish and I'm sensitive about that stuff. Of course it's a small mistake, all is forgiven. Then the new tidbit of insight from a blonde's head was that my friend "looked like marina boys."  That's a bad move, he doesn't like the Marina, and he lives close enough to catch shit for it regularly.

Here's the similarities between my group and yours, we don't live in the Marina.
Here's the differences, my group doesn't think it's a compliment to be called Marina-esqe. 

So please young woman, if you are so hateful about living in the Sunset (understandable) then move out, go to the Marina! If there's anything more sad than a Marina mom it's a Marina wannabe. But that was really just more funny than anything else as my friend decided to push the issue, "What about me makes you think Marina, seriously I'm not going to hold it against you, I want to know so I can rid myself of it, what makes you think Marina?" Her back peddle and eventual excuse was hilarious. More importantly the other friend (after a solid four hours of drinking), pulls a half eaten burrito from her purse and begins munching on it. It wasn't wrapped well in the foil, I'm sure there are rice and beans all over her purse. I proceed to ask her with awe "where'd you get that?!" I'm meaning, why was it in your purse, she's a bit more literal and states some place in union sqaure. She didn't know the name. She goes there twice a week. What, is wrong, with her?

She should know the place's name, she shouldn't have left it in her purse, and for god sakes "real San Franciscans don't eat Mexican food anywhere but the mission. Not even in Mexico!" (Sally K.)

anyway, called em a cab and went to bed -- just another night in laurel heights -- and a vote for why you met girls at the bar, and don't bring them with you.

Proximity to the Bridge Theater (currently playing Grindhouse) is a huge plus and bumps it up to the 5th star!
author: Tyler W.

description: I am in bad shape.  Thanks Pig and Whistle for getting me there.
author: Nick T.

description: Popped in here for a few pints with a friend Sunday afternoon and was glad I did.  There's ample parking at the end of the block on Anza which is always a rarity in this city.  Inside you'll find a fairly generic pub with a nice selection of taps, decent booze selection, a nice amount of tables, and a back room with a pool table and pinball.  We had an order of fried mushrooms which were a notch above the pub grub you'd get at most pubs.  All in all, there are a lot worse ways to kill some time on a dreary Sunday afternoon.  Plus, you know it's a proper pub when you're standing at the bar waiting for a pint and overhear two brits bitching about the "bloody french".
author: Joshua W.

description: This is not a bar where you order mixed drinks, this is a bar where you order beer, good pub food, and play some pool or pinball  with your pals in the back room!  This is bar that most of my friends have been having their birthday gatherings at and this is a good thing, because it's a down to earth good bar.  But if your the kind of person that takes more than 3 hours to get ready, and expect others to look like they do too this place my friend is not for you..."
author: Cassie L.

description: This place is great! Awesome beer selection. Surprisingly good bar food. Free pool on Sunday afternoons and EPL on the telly! I mean really...when you've got an hour to kill before seeing a flick at The Bridge...this is the place to go. Oh, cute bartenders too.
author: Kate P.

description:
it's kind of sad....I've lived in SF for about 11 or so yrs and I used to go there quite often...they were a nice chill down to earth pub...I don't know if  the ownership has changed hands BUT......
now they have awful service...there's the american guy with long sideburns who always seemed to forget my order and beer....ignores me as if this was a super busy place, and is a prick about it.....Then there's the fat english guy who's as equally a prick, ignores me anytime I ask him about beer or my order being late he's got the attitude and ego the size of universe, very conceated person
....Last time they completely forgot my order and the did give it to me for free (but it happens almost everytime)....The only nice person who works there is the blond women....I think she feels bad that the other 2 are such bad service...
You're not cool guys....you're rude and unproffecional....
good luck
author: Alex W.

description: The perfect bar to call your own.  When crowded on weekend nights, it's a good place to drink till you can't drink anymore.  During quiet afternoons, it's cozy, comfortable, and slightly melancholy.  Weekday nights are my favorite times when there's just the right amount of cheer.  The food is excellent... good enough to drive across town just to eat.
author: Charly L.

description: Couple of my friends live around the corner from this place and it's their main hang.  I've personally only been a couple times and it's your typical pub vibe inside.   A really great Irish breakfast served here too.  Hits the spot when your hungry and hungover!
author: Mary R.

description: The pig is the shit! It's mine and my roommate's favorite bar.  If you're looking for a comfortable, laid back spot to enjoy a guinness with friends, this is the place. Awesome bartenders too.
author: Liza Z.

description:
Nice Place, mellow environment, (except when the games on!). 

Love that they have Strongbow Cider, my absolute favorite. The curry fries are definitely worth a try.

Its nice to find a place with a pool table and darts as well.
author: Kristin C.

description: Wed night is trivia night and that is when you gotta go!  So much fun.  Great bartenders and a fun atmosphere make this a fun place for both Americans and for people who have moved from the other side of the pond.  Get yourself some Bangers and Mash or some Curry Fries, a pint, and an entry form...but get there early if you want a table!
author: Pele N.

description: This is the cleanest pub I have ever been to.  It's a really chill neighborhood place, has good Irish food...darts, pool table in the back....music isn't too loud.  When it's your birthday, they are really friendly.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Great hamburger and fries.  Guiness to wash it down.  Football on TV.  What else is there?
author: Corey V.

description: Lots of parking, cheapest Long Island I'd ever had (though it was missing something), and trivia nights on Wednesdays.  Kinda smellier than the places I usually go but, if I'm nearby...why not stop for a drink?
author: Tiff L.

description: Fun, but not my favorite even though I live across the street. It's a cool bar, but it gets super stuffy. Maybe I just haven't given it enough of a chance because I get annoyed with the loud people that stumble out on Sunday nights and wake me up. Whatevs, I'm that person on other nights of the week so I guess I can't judge...
author: Jacky C.

description: Fun and Friendly. Trivia is fun and my group won best small group! Round of free beers. Lots of stuff on tap!
author: Miray V.

description: It's all about the quiz nights, baby.  I'm a particular fan of the themed round.  The staff are great, the quizzes fun, AND they've Fullers on tap.  What more can a girl ask for?  I'm glad one of the bikers wrote a review--whenever they're not there the place is so empty my friends and I get worried that quiz night's been canceled.
author: Jessica C.

description: Fun friendly bartenders, Good place for games, Darts, pool, dice... haven't eaten there but it always smells good.
author: Rachel L.

description: The perfect pub. Here you feel like you're in England. You can't beat it for an early evening beer and dinner followed by a game of darts. The fish'n'chips is the best in the city. Cool S.F. old timers kick it at the P&W.
author: Chris S.

description: I heart the Pig, for sentimental reasons.  I used to come here quite often for happy hour (5-6) when I worked in the area.  It's never loud or obnoxiously crowded in there which makes it a good place to grab some beer, grub on some Bangers and Mash, and catch up on the latest with your chicas.  The post 9-5 crowd tends to be heavily middle-aged male.  They tend to not bother you - they're far too enamored by whatever game is on.  The bartenders are great though they can be difficult to get a hold of during happy hour.  The food service though is pretty quick.
author: Jean A.

description: I had an okay time. I'm not commenting on food or drink, but my experience. These old men who sported really short shorts and looked like they had just spent the afternoon playing croquet in Golden Gate Park refused to give us their table in the back (even though no one was sitting -  they were just using it to keep their stuff), so 5 of us were left to sit at the bar. Mixed crowd, mainly an old sausage fest.
author: Monica N.

description:
Came here for pre-movie drinks on a Saturday. Great happy hour specials of $3 pints. Awesome beer selection and an authentic atmosphere, which you don't get a lot in SF. 

Place smells incredibly of fish and chips. That's not a value judgement, but consider yourself warned if you don't like that type of thing.
author: Kris E.

description: Nice pub, good fried food.  My date and I ordered WAY too much food, though.  We got the fish and chips, jalapeno poppers, onion rings, and some other fried food I can't remember.  Nice place to go if you just want to relax and get some grub.  There's a pool table in the back as well as darts to keep you occupied.
author: Sarah F.

description:
3.5 Stars.
Fun pub. Good beers on tap. Terrible food.
author: Matt G.

description: This is my neighborhood pub, which I have gone to 2-4 times a month for the last 3 years, usually for trivia night. Good beer selection, decent pub food, and the staff is incredibly friendly. If you're in the neighborhood hop in and try the curry fries!
author: Andrea S.

description: I am a big fan of The Pig and Whistle.  This is a great place to go on a weekday for some mellow beers, or when you want to go out for drinks on the weekend but avoid huge crowds.  In addition to a great English beer selection, they also have solid pub food.  Nothing that's going to knock your socks off, but decent food that's cheap.  I always try to convince my friends to go here, but they never want to.  Maybe it's time I reevaluate the people I call "friends"...
author: Jon M.

description: An old man's pub with a lot of charm. I'm a brit so i'm a fan of the decor and the strongbow cider on tap!!! YAY!! The crowd is kind of old and sometimes it smells like a soiled diaper, but that all goes away after a drink or two. Great place to go with a group, a parent or a college professor.
author: Chloe D.

description:
Burgers and Fries are great ! 
My son - who is 12 was allowed in - since it was the day time. we both loved the burgers and fries.

Haven't been at night.
A friend loves the ales.
author: Jeanne D.

description: A great, unpretentious neighborhood pub. Good selection of beer and spirits and yummy fries (er, chips). Nice back pool table room and even a pinball machine. Cheers!
author: A Y.

description: I love the pig...the food is greasy bar food, and I'm sure you can get the same beers in other bars, but so many different crowds come here, and trivia nights are surprisingly fun.  bring a bunch of friends.  It's a very relaxed place.  I think they offer free pool on Suns, and there's erotic photo hunt and a pinball machine in the back room. Don't sit by the bathrooms- smells like cleaning products.
author: ann m.

description: This is my new Thursday night or Saturday day spot. The bartender is cool and the drinks are good... Been here almost 7 years and just found out how cool this place is 3 weeks ago.  Like the vibe, food and drinks..
author: T S.

description: Heavy, rustic meals and a decent beer selection. Not what I usually go for, but I wasn't disappointed. If I was more into pub food I'd come back any time. I liked that the place is pretty mellow for being a pub.
author: Dennis G.

description:
decent grub with a nice selection of beers. this is my go-to pub for a  relaxing night with good friends. i can have a normal conversation without having to scream my thoughts or shift from foot to foot in my red 3-inch stilettos and hip hugging jeans with just the right amount of spandex (yeah, ladies, you know what i'm talkin' about).

the barkeeps are rather gruff, but their attitudes add to the ambience and reminds me of the neighborhood pub a couple blocks away from where i lived in northwest london a few years ago. 

extra star for the low-low prices (irish bank makes bank by ripping your hard-earned dollars downtown), and the fact that i can sit and choke back a guinness without a care in the world.
author: May T.

description: This is a great mellow pub at which to stop before you head to Trader Joe's for groceries (or after, if you're not buying perishables). They have good happy hour specials, nice pub grub, a generally low-key crowd, and generally plenty of tables during the day. The fries, which I have sworn off for the sake of my figure, appear to be hand-cut. They have a good selection of wines by the glass if beer isn't your thing. All in all, I have to love this place even though their softball team beat mine last year in the tournament. Rematch, bitches!
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Good prices for decent food. I ordered bangers and mash, which I usually like to get at pub places. They were good. The beer and other drinks seemed reasonably priced as well. I would like to come back and try their English breakfast.
author: Helena H.

description: I remember going here 10 years ago and some guy in a wheelchair asked me to hold his catheter while he pissed in the street. What was I supposed to do, say no? I hear its gotten classier and more filled with douchey USF students since then.
author: Andrew L.

description: The Pig and Whistle is awesome! They have extremely friendly bartenders who are always open to making concoctions with whatever parameters I give them (I like to be surprised). The number of beers they have on draught is great. I just love being able to call this place my local bar. Anyone who hasn't been should get over there!
author: Rachel F.

description: This is the place for a meeting after the meeting, if you know what I mean. I enjoy the fish and chips here as well as the boddington's...good place to  spend a lazy afternoon.
author: Charlene L.

description: Not a bad pub at all.  Really friendly and lots of local Irish folks hang out here.  I highly suggest going during the day, as it has a totally different, relaxed vibe, reminicent of the "public houses" in Ireland.  People are reading the paper, eating food and generally just hanving a relaxing time together.  Worth a stop in.
author: Matthew R.

description: I live a block away from the Pig & Whistle and it's the closest thing I have to a neighborhood bar. It's got a nice relaxed vibe and the fish and chips are yummy. I wish they had a fooseball table but they don't. Sigh. So only three stars.
author: Cathy T.

description: They pour Guniness the way it's meant to be done. A frothy head and a clover on the top. The short wait for a pint is worth it for this little bit of perfection.
author: Rob H.

description:
this is the kind of place that makes it hard to write a review. it's a british pub, with all the usual qualities you'd imagine it to have. lots of beer. pool and darts. laid back atmosphere. there's really not much i can say about it that really stands out. i've read that it has fantastic pub food, but we didnt try any when we were there. what i did try, was this beer called Old Speckled Hen. the beer, despite it's bizarre name (which oddly enough is a reference to MG cars), was damn good. it reminded me of this other creamy ale that i had back in london. it was so good actually, that i wasn't able to try anything else since i just kept ordering the same thing over and over and over. even if that beer was the only thing that stands out for me about Pig and Whistle, it still makes it worth going back.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com )
author: vlad k.

description: This place is cool - we drank, we played darts, and then....we promptly got kicked out right at 2am.  Not even a five minute grace period to finish our drinks!!  The bartender mumbled something about how she has a new, hot boyfriend to get home to.....WHATEVER!
author: Megan H.

description: I have almost no memory of being there last weekend. That's a good sign, right?
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
i should be here more often since i live across the street, but it is probably more of a good thing that i'm not...i'd probably look just like i did when i was studying in england, 20 lbs heavier and a pasty complexion.  

this one of my favorite places to bring out of town guests where we can catch up and play a friendly game of darts.  i love that they sell blackthorn, as i'm more of a cider gal.  i've only eaten their food once, and i wasn't too impressed.  i had a pasty which was made out of puff pastry, not dough like it was when i had one in england.  maybe i don't know my english food well enough, but i'm willing to give it another go the next time i stop in for a pint.
author: Sheryl D.

description: I like this place.  The beer selection is good, the bar staff is friendly and the pub food hits the spot.  Definitely a favorite neighborhood spot.
author: Matt H.

description: After living in the neighborhood for nearly 8 years, I've ventured into the P&W only a handful of times.  Never to eat, always to drink.  As far as drinking goes, pretty standard.  What got me writing this review is the food.  A very pleasant surprise.  Bangin' bangers and mash, gravy-licious steak and mushroom pie and fresh fish and chips.  I've been back to eat every week for the past three weeks.  Very nice staff.  They even call me lad... and I'm asian!
author: Ed G.

description:
This place is awesome. I went there with my roommate and we walked right in, grabbed a seat at the bar, and got a pint of goodness within 40 seconds of walking through the door. The bartenders were awesome, way nice and super friendly. This place is definitely within walking distance from our pad and that alone gives it 4 stars. Not giving it 5 just yet, cuz i need to walk in during trivia night and try out the irish breakfast.yummm. 
Oh ya, and the name of the place is just awesome.
author: Shannon G.

description:
GREAT PLACE!!!

I have been coming to this bar for a couple months, mostly on Wednesday and Sundays for trivia night, and it's always a blast!

Great beer selection, great food, and an extremely friendly bar staff make this one of those places that feel more like going over to a friends house rather than to a bar. The regulars there are all very nice, and the bi-weekly trivia night adds a little something extra that makes this place unique.

More than a bar, this place is a neighborhood home for worn out students and anyone else just looking to have a good time, with good beer, and good friends.

Without hesitation, 5 Stars.
author: Brian S.

description: Soccer sucks.  I played for like, two days when I was a kid.  I stopped not because I sucked (I totally sucked), but because I totally sucked.  THAT'S ALL THEY SHOW HERE.  Soccer sucks.  This place is pretty cool because they show a lot of soccer.  But soccer sucks.  They have London Pride.
author: keith k.

description: Nice pub atmosphere near my home.  Who's complaining?  Drinks are generous and it's possible to talk to your friends - background noise isn't overwhelming.  I like the crowd too!
author: She-Ra ..

description: I've always enjoyed myself at the Pig & Whistle. Used to have a friend who worked there, my first venture in. Since then I realized how great a location for a pub - right near a theater! This way you can easily get prepared for, and/or rehash a film. Mainly I only patronize P&W when I go to the Bridge. Excellent selection of beer (Old Speckled Hen) and tasty grub!
author: Colleen B.

description: They pour 'em tall and strong, and serve 'em with Irish attitude - what more do you need to know?
author: Tony L.

description:
surprisingly good food to go along with a credit-card-accepting full bar! they've got darts, pool [so you won't have to get fleeced at family billiards next door], lots of space to sit down, and clientele that's either still in college or can't believe they're not in it anymore.

gets crowded on USF basketball nights, but with your game ticket stub you get a free beer.

[however, i didn't give up my ticket the last time USF beat gonzaga, for obvious reasons]

alwways worth a stop, nowhere near as grungy as some people claim.

[well, except for the bathroom. now that's just wrong.]
author: Charles C.

description: P and I stopped here for a quick drink, a Stoli soda for me and a Jameson 7 for him.  P gave the bartendress a $20 and got $12 back.  We checked with the bartendress to see if this was right?  Her answer was "You came to the right bar."  What a deal!  We'll definitely come again. The Pig & Whistle also serves pub food, as well as hosts a huge projector screen and a bunch more flat screens, perfect to catch the World Series or the Superbowl.
author: Pelle Y.

description: 4 Stars for Pub atmosphere, being authentic and having great burgers and mash that come out Hot and Delicious.  Great selection of Beers here also.  Great place to come and grab a burger and beer or some of their other food.
author: Piper C.

description: Great place to have a drink in the neighborhood.  Good burgers and the Fish and Chips is huge.  Big thing to hit is the Pub Quiz on Weds. nights.  Local drunks are very friendly.
author: Michael M.

description: I've only been here twice since moving to the neighborhood but I can already tell it's going to be an awesome place to grab a drink with friends. There's a good mix of people and everyone seems very chill, and if that's not incentive enough, the curry fries were AMAZING. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Monica M.

description: I like this place, My friends took me here for my birthday.. it was a good time and the beers/whisky shots were good. There was tons of room for my large party.. and there was parking too. I had a blast! Next time Im going to try the food!
author: kristen n.

description: Wed night Trivia at it's best. Funny English dude and good beer and grub. 8:30pm
author: Erik R.

description: What can I say, this was my first neighborhood bar while living in SF and it still doesn't disappoint.  Great variety of beers, great staff and the food is actually pretty good too.  This is one of the rare places that still respects regulars by offering a greeting, not to mention sneaking in an occasional free or insanely cheap drink.  Wednesday trivia nights are fun but can get ridiculously crowded.  It is prone to the occasional way too drunk guy or tough guy at the pool table but overall this is still a fun bar I will never mind going to.
author: Steven R.

description: A decent faux british/Irish bar with a good pub trivia night...nothing more/nothing less...but a good option for those inner richmond kids (bless em')
author: Francis K.

description: Good place to meet up with friends. Pretty mellow irish bar....fun trivia nights.
author: Adrienne G.

description: I haven't been to the Pig & Whistle in ages, but used to come here once a month or so for traditional English breakfast -- sausages, potatoes, baked beans, toast, eggs. It's wonderful and authentically done, and hits just the right spot if you've ever been to England and had one of their full breakfasts. The other pub-food items are also tasty and authentic, supposedly procured from the British Food supplier down the road on Geary. The jukebox, with an eye toward soul/punk music popular in London, is also a nice treat.
author: Beth W.

description: I've been to this place a couple of times with my boyfriend and his coworkers and it is a good place o go to hang out, chill, realx, drink and eat food! they have an item on the food menu..the irish sausages? i highly recommend them! really yummy!
author: Kathleen P.

description: Good fish and chips, good atmosphere, good pub!
author: chris m.

description:
British grub, best brit music, darts, pinball, pool, and a good drink selection. 
they also have a dart league and free pool sunday from noon til 830pm.
author: Blazia K.

description: If you are one of the few people who like british pub food, this is the place in the city to go to.  They actually have real british blackthorn apple cider, none of that pear crap.  you can order a cider and black.  that's cider and black currant cordial mixed together.  it's a tasty british drink that is hard to find in bars around this city.  Wednesday nights they also have a good pub quiz.
author: Monica L.

description:
There is a sweet little old lady named Kay that is somewhat of a regular at Pig & Whistle.  My friend and I sat and talked to her the other night for a couple of hours - one of the best conversations I've had in a while.  When she finished her second drink, she asked the bartender (possibly the owner, but I'm not sure) to call her a cab.  It took a while for the cab to arrive, so the bartender called again, and repeatedly looked outside to check for the cab.  Finally, while out having a smoke, my friend hailed a cab and kept him there while the bartender and I helped Kay out of the bar with her walker.  Now, Kay is of the generation that still believes that $1.00 is a sufficient tip to give to the nice young man who helped her to her seat and brought her drinks to her.  Unfortunately, a lot of bartenders wouldn't be so helpful and nice to Kay, but this bartender (I wish I could remember his name!) was.  He gets my four stars.  

Besides the very nice staff, Pig & Whistle has a good beer selection and pretty good Irish pub food.  It's a fun place to spend a weekend afternoon playing pool, watching the game, or talking to Kay.
author: Sara H.

description: This place is simply great; I love the old-style Euro decor and atmosphere, and the drink prices aren't too bad either. This place has a pool room in the back, offers a full pub menu, and conducts a team-oriented trivia night every Wednsday and Sunday evening at 8:30. I've never had a team big enough, to compete for major prizes, but I've won a couple of free drinks in the bonus round. The staff are all cool people, and definitely won't shy away from talking to you a bit if they've seen you around here before. The location (near Geary and Masonic) is also great, since the 38 runs 24/7. If you attend USF and are looking for a cool place right by campus to hang out, I highly reccomend you stop in here one day, if you haven't already.
author: Sean R.

description: Good place. I had a weekend lunch here with a friend. It was mostly empty, but I assume it gets more buisiness at other times. I lived in England for a year and miss the pub grub. This place does a worthy rendition and has the right feel - only thing missing is the haze of cigarette smoke, which, though gross and totally non-California, does make for a  complete pub experience. Other than that though, this place is pretty authentic. The guy behind the bar was nice too. I'll go back for a pint and a nice hearty steak and mushroom pie any day.
author: Caitlin H.

description: One of my favorite places to go for pub trivia.  Fish and chips are acceptable but I'm not there to have dinner.  The drink prices are very reasonable and the bartenders (thank goodness!) know how to make a Black Velvet.
author: Eileen Q.

description:
I've gone here a few times after work on Sunday.  Yummy Shepherd's pie, great beer and a good atmosphere.  Only, if you're not a big sports fan, it's kinda hard to hear your friends speak over the TV.

I'm here again with my hubby who doesn't drink & says that pub food only tastes good when you're plastered and HE likes the food :).
author: Nisaa K.

description:
Spending some time here on a Friday eve.  Playing some cards, drinking some (cheap) good beer, and having some fun.  My drunk friend ( who got a little too excited becoming vp In the game of ASSHOLE) knocked over her glass of Stella and the bartender gave us a whole new
Pitcher.  That's what I call great service.
author: J P.

description:
Great fish and chips, except that every once in a while, the chips come out like half-raw potatoes or greasy little clumps.  I'm not sure why the fries are so inconsistent when the fish is almost always great.

Don't bother with the burgers.  They are a major disappointment; I'm sure made with bargain-basement beef and served with the same take-what-you-get fried potatoes as come with the fish and chips.

Beer!  The Pig and Whistle excels in both the variety of beers and how they serve them.  If nothing else, I'd probably return to this place for the fish and beer--to hell with the chips.
author: Richard C.

description:
some call it a dive bar... i call it my second home. I find it difficult to find a comfortable bar in which people are relaxed, but this is it. The bartenders like Jenny, the Steves, Paul, etc all make an effort to remember your name. It looks like it was one Ye o' Smokey pub gone college style. I don't think I'd like it so much if i didn't go to USF though, its definitely a college hang out. 
Definitely make an effort to go on Quiz Night on Wednesday (they also have one on Sunday but its much more intense... much more about the quiz than it is about socializing). Ray, the guy asking the questions at quiz night, always comes up with great stuff. Don't ever expect to win unless you show up with a big group, but its always fun to get wasted and try. 
The music is rock mostly, some new, some old. They have a decent selection of beer, a huge selection of liquor, and a little bit of wine. The food is OK, again, very much pub food. I just love how chill this place is.
author: Triana L.

description: I've been going to the Pig and Whistle for going on ten years and I am never disappointed. Whether I have the best fish and chips in town or the sausage rolls, the fare while not haute cuisine is exactly what one expects in a traditional British pub and they deliver ten times out of ten. They also keep an excellent selection of draught beers on tap. Plus, they now have a full bar and live music most weekends (usually no cover).
author: D Scott D.

description: The Pig & Whistle is a great place for a brew and some pub food on a foggy San Francisco evening...the Man friend and I went there on a whim and had a great meal (although not the healthiest of choices, delicious) and some pints.  Much to our luck, Wednesday night trivia turned out to be super fun as well!
author: Meg C.

description:
This place is awesome, very neighborhood feel.  Lots of beer options, and pretty cheap.  The bartenders are pretty fast and have just enough British grit to keep it real.

The food is actually very good for pub grub and they have an awesome trivia night on Wed and Sunday.
author: Brian W.

description: We used to go here all the time when we lived a block away.The bartenders are always nice. The guy who runs the place can be kind of an asshole though. I saw him yelling at some kids for playing a drinking game. And when it hits last call they're dicks about kicking you out ASAP. And there are no good drink specials on off nights! What's up with that??
author: N. M.

description: Love this place! Best English Pub in town.  Fish and chips rule! Prices are great.  But the best thing about the Pig and Whistle is that they will let you play Risk for hours as long as you keep buying drinks.
author: Erin L.

description: when asab was closed on sunday night, my roomies and i stumbled upon pig and whistle for gargantuan portions of beer battered fish and chips.  beers were dangerously cheap and  sundays you'll find free pool until 8.  they ended up hosting us for trivia, which included a picture sheet of famous people (including a young john wayne- which we guessed correctly, thank you!) and songs (featuring tori amos and the bangles)!
author: Emily J.

description: Great neighborhood pub!  It has all the classic British beers, including my favorite, Old Speckled Hen.  Strongbow fans need look no further.  The only food I've tried is the fish & chips, which are quite decent and come in generous portions.
author: Jenny G.

description:
big fan of the whistlin' pig. great staff all the way around. good vibe, mellow crowd. jukebox has a good selection. decent but small pool table in the back, and a dart board. 

two bathrooms! 

side exit for easy smoke breaks and make-out sessions. 

they even have a pinball machine. parking is usually very easy. i would say good selection of beer, not great. but, they have somewhere around 20 on tap, not too shabby. 

the food is definitely bar food, none of it very special. though, i will definitely recommend their fish and chips.

they do have a trivia night, but its pretty much the same as the ten thousand other places in the city.

underberg shots for $3!
author: Dayman D.

description: It seemed like it had potential but service was horrible. Had to wait for ever to get a drink and it wasn't busy.
author: Tim M.

description: great for a pint o' beer, an order of fish & chips, and a combination of scary older drunk men who apparently are regulars, a mix of young college hipsters who have wandered down the hill from USF, and us, the locals who know everyone that works there by name.  it gets packed on trivia nights and has a decent jukebox and pool table.  definitely a local hangout.  not a singles bar or a place to see and be seen.  sports are always on tv.
author: Cyn B.

description: $5 for a guiness but i don't care, it's poured oh so daaaaamn fine. fries with pepper sauce and vinegar, and a rousing quiz night. i'm into it.
author: Rebecca M.

description: monday was a good time and place to be for darts and pub grub, daytime tender is good, the grub good, the darts good, switch to night staff; change over like day and night, night crew vacant and lack of hustle ...avoid the crowds and do days until changeover, ouch!
author: tim y.

description: I can't say I've any authority to speak on the subject myself, but I will say that I'm not surprised at all by the other comments here that the Pig & Whistle is one of the more authentic English pubs going in SF.  It's more or less exactly how I'd imagine one--dark and comfortable, with football (don't call it "soccer," mate) on the telly and real Brits behind the bar.  Speaking of which, they've an enviable selection of import beers on tap here, and you're advised to sample 'em copiously.  A separate room in the back for snooker (what's "pool?") and darts (yeah, you can call those "darts"), all kinds of fascinating old framed photos gracing the walls, and a certain subtle elegance is suggested by the dark-stained wood.  The food isn't too shabby either, long as you're partial to pub chow--I had the fish fry and it's oily but that's to be expected.  More importantly, it was light and crispy and the chips were pretty dern tasty.  Another little gem I'm proud to have in my neighborhood.
author: Michael T.

description: Nice place to hang, good service, cool locals and no fuss and muss.  Casual atmosphere when you want it.
author: Misti L.

description: Yes, a great selection of beer on tap.  Was dead the night I was there, but I like that.  Played pool in the back.  It's my neighborhood bar.  I can stumble the 2 blocks home, but it's tricky because I've gotta stumble up the hill.
author: Christine H.

description: Welcome to dive bar heaven.  This place is directly across the street from two of my friends apartment.  My friend is a drunk and is here at least 5 nights a week for food & drinks.  We start off and usually end every night out with the Pig, sometimes we don't even leave.  All of the bartenders are awesome and laid back.  The food is typical bar food, plus a daily british special, but lets be honest you shouldn't be going there for food.  They also set up huge projectors for NFL, MLB, & NBA playoffs.  They have 15-20 beers on tap at all times and have a full bar now after years of being beer & wine only.  They have a pooltable, pinball, & photohunt games.  Go for Pubquiz on Sunday & Wednesday nights for cash & drink prizes.  The cash is nice, but it usually equates to less than the "round" of drinks you win for second place.  Not quite as fun as it used to be, but still a pretty fun dive.
author: dustin c.

description: best fish and chips in the city- hands down, no contest!
author: Beth M.

description: Wednesday night the Pig & Whistle is the place to be for quiz night. I used to live down the street and my roommates and I would be sure to go and test our knowledge. Get there early though as tables fill up! Come here any other night though and its just like any pub...
author: Annie L.

description: Been here lots. Basically these are my people and this is my jam. I just got a car again so I spun over to have some bangers and mash or maybe the shepards pie. Oh shit! they must have changed ownership! The food had no lard content and was somewhat flavorfull. Look,... basic British (or welsh irish or scotch) food has little or no flavor. Thats the rules. Those folks either boil things in sheeps blood or alcohol, and fry or bake eveything else to tastless bland death. The food is being made by someone else now and it tastes ok even when sober. I love beer that could pass for liquified bread, boddingtons, newcastle, guiness,... bring it on. Good jukebox still, (anyone remember 'lost in the supermarket' by the clash?) and I threw some darts too. I also got a couple a free ones simply by virtue of my pasty complexion and the hue of my hair. Sorry but I dont have a lick of Irish in me. Ok so I had to abandond my newly aquired car until the next day, it was worth it.
author: dave p.

description: this could soon be 4 stars but i've only just been there the once. after four years in The Richmond i never came across this place. very sad since i enjoyed myself and it's within walking distance of my place. just a regular old pub. friendly bartenders. great beers on tap. pool and darts. overall nice atmo. i'll be back hopefully many more times.
author: Daniel N.

description: Great place!  Very comfortable environment!  Great beer selection!  Healthy sized shots and possibly the best fish and chips in the city!  They also sponsor a cool softball team.
author: Marko C.

description: didn't go for trivia night, a decent place except for one thing, the fish market that operates in the same building. the smell dissipated after the first drink and after that  it isn't even noticeable unless you step outside for a smoke and then you will smell the fish when you enter once again. not too big a problem. the place isn't great but it gets the job done and if you are in walking distance then all the better.
author: Sam S.
